analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa'i le'u sum cu pa nas bstan to // mtshan ma yang yin la phyag rgya yang yin pas na mtshan ma'i phyag rgya ste las 'dzin @211a * //

original: pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: pa'i bsdu ba'o //

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa lha'i 'khor lo ni zhes pa la zhal gsum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor sngon du 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa lha'i 'khor lo ni zhes pa la zhal gsum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor sngon du 'dri ba'o //
translated: The wheel of the deities such as Ak·π£obhya, he says. The ma·πá·∏çalas of Cittavajra and so forth are drawn first in the form of having three faces and so forth.

analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i zhes pa ni zhal gsum la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gyi phyag rgya yang yin la /
translated: The great seal, he says. The seal of the nature of having three faces and so forth is also a seal.

analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ni bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i 'dri bar bya ba'i sku zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The great seal is the body of the Bhagavat Akshobhya and so forth, which is to be drawn.

analyzed: de la phyag rgya chen po ni sems kyi rang bzhin yin te sems nyid de'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The great seal is the nature of mind, because mind itself appears in its aspect.

analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya ni ngag gi rang bzhin te yig 'bru rnams ngag yin pas so //

analyzed: mtshan ma'i phyag rgya ni lus kyi rang bzhin te de rnams su lus kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //

original: sems can gyi rgyud thams cad la ltos nas zhes pa ni gti mug dang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi rigs can gyi sems can gyi rgyud thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba dang rigs dang bag chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the attitudes, dormant tendencies, families, habitual tendencies, and so forth.

original: ltos nas zhes pa ni de rnams la brten pas so //
analyzed: ltos nas zhes pa ni de rnams la brten pas so //

original: rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gis //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gis //

analyzed: zhes pa ni blo la gnas pa dbye ba gsum gyi chos la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya rnams so //
translated: the seals are the phenomena, etc. , which are the three divisions that abide in the mind.

original: dgod pa yang bya'o zhes pa ni de dag thams cad bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dgod pa yang bya'o zhes pa ni de dag thams cad bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should also set forth means that all of those should be drawn, that is the meaning.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te gal te gti mug gi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pa yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te gal te gti mug gi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pa yin na de'i tshe /
translated: This is what is being said: If one is a practitioner of the deluded type, then at that time,

analyzed: phyag rgya chen pos mtshan ma'i dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: one should draw the sign ma·πá·∏çala with the great seal.

original: de bzhin 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi rigs can dag la ltos nas chos dang mtshan ma'i phyag rgya dag dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi rigs can dag la ltos nas chos dang mtshan ma'i phyag rgya dag dgod par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, in dependence on those of the passionate and the hateful types, one should set forth the phenomena and sign seals.

analyzed: de dag la nye bar mtshon pa'i don tsam du zhes pa ni chos dang phyag rgya chen po dag mtshon par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of merely indicated with respect to those is that the phenomena and the great seals are to be indicated.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Because they are not different, as was previously explained.

original: mtshan ma'i phyag rgya zhes pa ni zhe sdang gi rigs can gyi phal che ba la brten pas so //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i phyag rgya zhes pa ni zhe sdang gi rigs can gyi phal che ba la brten pas so //
translated: The seal of signs is so called because it is based on most of those who are of the type of hatred.

original: zhe sdang gi de kho na nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa zhe sdang dang de'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang thugs rdo rje 'chang gis sbyang bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi de kho na nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa zhe sdang dang de'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang thugs rdo rje 'chang gis sbyang bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the reality of hatred means that the mind-vajra-holder purifies the afflictions of hatred and the secondary afflictions that are related to and associated with hatred.

original: rnam shes zhe sdang bshad pa ste //
analyzed: rnam shes zhe sdang bshad pa ste //
translated: Consciousness is explained as hatred.

original: spong dang @211b rig pa gnyis sbyor bas //
analyzed: spong dang @211b rig pa gnyis sbyor bas //
translated: The abandonment and the knowledge are united.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rdo rje ni 'jigs pa rnams kyang 'jigs par byed pa'o zhes pa ni 'khor ba las 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni 'jigs pa rnams kyang 'jigs par byed pa'o zhes pa ni 'khor ba las 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis so //
translated: The vajra terrifies even the terrifiers means that the two obscurations, the afflictive and the knowledge obscurations, are the terrifiers of those who are terrified of cyclic existence.

original: de yang 'jigs par byed pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rim pas 'joms par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de yang 'jigs par byed pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rim pas 'joms par byed pa ste /
translated: And the vajra terrifies them because it destroys them through the stages of the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: It is the pristine wisdom of the expanse of reality.

original: de nyid dbyer med pas na rdo rje ste //
analyzed: de nyid dbyer med pas na rdo rje ste //
translated: It is a vajra because it is indivisible.

original: rdo rje'i gzugs su phyi rol tu snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje'i gzugs su phyi rol tu snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a vajra because it appears externally in the form of a vajra.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As is said:

original: spang bya lnga dang rig pa lnga //
analyzed: spang bya lnga dang rig pa lnga //
translated: The five things to be abandoned and the five insights

original: rdo rje zhes bya mngon par bshad //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya mngon par bshad //
translated: are explained as the vajra.

original: brtan pa snying po khong stong med //
analyzed: brtan pa snying po khong stong med //
translated: It is firm, with a core, and without hollowness,

original: gcod med dbyer med mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: gcod med dbyer med mtshan nyid can //
translated: inseparable, and with the characteristic of being indivisible.

original: bsreg pa med cing 'jig med pa //
analyzed: bsreg pa med cing 'jig med pa //
translated: It is not burned and not destroyed,

original: stong pa nyid ni rdo rjer bshad /üîΩces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rdo rjer bshad / ces 'byung ngo //
translated: emptiness is explained as the vajra.

original: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so zhes pa ni me long lta bu la sogs pa mi phyed pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so zhes pa ni me long lta bu la sogs pa mi phyed pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The vajra is the Tathagatas, because it is the nature of the five kinds of insight, such as the mirror-like, which are indivisible.

original: 'od zer lnga ste zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi rab 'byams lnga'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: 'od zer lnga ste zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi rab 'byams lnga'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is the five light rays, because it is the nature of the five kinds of extensive activities, such as pacifying.

original: des 'khor lo rnam par brgyan pa'o zhes pa ni 'od zer lnga dang ldan pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag mtshan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des 'khor lo rnam par brgyan pa'o zhes pa ni 'od zer lnga dang ldan pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag mtshan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is adorned with a wheel, meaning that it is the hand implement of Vairocana, endowed with the five light rays.

original: des ni 'khor lo kha dog dkar po yin na yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni 'khor lo kha dog dkar po yin na yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin bstan pa yin te /
translated: This shows that even though the wheel is white in color, it has the nature of the reality of the five transcendent lords.

original: gang gi phyir me long lta bu'i ye shes ni mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi chas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir me long lta bu'i ye shes ni mnyam pa nyid la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi chas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because mirror-like primordial wisdom is pervaded by the aspects of the primordial wisdoms of sameness and so forth.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: The others should be understood in the same way.

original: rin po che la 'od zer gyi tshogs kyi rgyal po'o zhes pa ni de bzhin du rin po che yang 'od zer lngas khyab pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rin po che la 'od zer gyi tshogs kyi rgyal po'o zhes pa ni de bzhin du rin po che yang 'od zer lngas khyab pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The king of the mass of light rays of the jewel is the same as the jewel pervaded by the five light rays.

original: kha dog sna lnga pa'o zhes pa ni ral gri'i rang bzhin gyi 'od lnga yin te /
analyzed: kha dog sna lnga pa'o zhes pa ni ral gri'i rang bzhin gyi 'od lnga yin te /
translated: The five colors are the five lights of the nature of the sword.

original: las thams cad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las thams cad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the all-purpose one.

original: gang gi phyir bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes kyis ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i phrin las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes kyis ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i phrin las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur bas so //

original: ral gri la 'od de'i tshogs kyis khyab pa'o zhes pa ni bya ba nan tan sgrub pas bsam pa sna tshogs pa'i gdul bya yin pas tshogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ral gri la 'od de'i tshogs kyis khyab pa'o zhes pa ni bya ba nan tan sgrub pas bsam pa sna tshogs pa'i gdul bya yin pas tshogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sword is pervaded by the collection of that light, because it is a collection of various disciples who are to be trained by the activity of accomplishing what needs to be done.

original: shar gyi mtshams la zhes pa ni me'i mtshams la'o //
analyzed: shar gyi mtshams la zhes pa ni me'i mtshams la'o //

analyzed: sprin gyi mdog 'dra ba ste zhes pa ni mag gi dbus gnag pa ste mig 'bras sngon po yin pas so //

original: mtha' dkar ba'i 'od dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni zhes pa la mig gi mtha' ma'i cha gnyis dkar po yin @212a * //
analyzed: mtha' dkar ba'i 'od dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni zhes pa la mig gi mtha' ma'i cha gnyis dkar po yin @212a * //

original: pas so // sprin gyi mdog dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba byas nas kha dog dkar po dang / nag po mig la bstan pa yin te me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid de kho na nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //

translated: The color of a cloud and so on indicates the collection of the function of apprehending, and the white and black colors are indicated in the eye, because the mirror-like wisdom sees the suchness, the nature of all things.

original: rdo rje'i rigs la ltos pa ste ;
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs la ltos pa ste ;

original: / zhes pa ni rdo rje'i phyag mtshan no //
analyzed: / zhes pa ni rdo rje'i phyag mtshan no //
translated: This is the vajra hand implement.

original: gang gi rin chen gyi rigs la ltos par gyur pa zhes pa ni nga rgyal kun de nas 'chad par 'dod na m'a ma k'i ni rin chen gyi rigs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi rin chen gyi rigs la ltos par gyur pa zhes pa ni nga rgyal kun de nas 'chad par 'dod na m'a ma k'i ni rin chen gyi rigs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since she is dependent on the jewel family, if one wishes to explain all the pride, then MƒÅmakƒ´ is of the jewel family.

analyzed: de'i tshe na rin po che yang m'a ma k'i ni phyag mtshan du gyur te zhes pa ni rin po che yang phyag mtshan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: rdo rje ni ma yin no zhes pa ni rdo rje tsam 'ba' zhig bkag pa zhes dgongs pa'o //

original: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du reg bya rdo rje ma dang / spyan ma dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma ste btsun mo mchog go //
analyzed: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du reg bya rdo rje ma dang / spyan ma dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma ste btsun mo mchog go //
translated: Then, in accordance with the sequence of the five tathƒÅgatas, there are Spar≈õavajrƒÅ, LocanƒÅ, MƒÅmakƒ´, PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´, and TƒÅrƒÅ, who are the supreme queens.

original: de la m'a ma k'i ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs yin pas gnyis ka'i rigs can ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de la m'a ma k'i ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs yin pas gnyis ka'i rigs can ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: stong pa nyid bzhi'i rang bzhin nyid du rab tu grags so //

original: de bas na zhe sdang dang nga rgyal dag dbyer med par byas nas thugs rdo rje dang yid bzhin nor bu'i rigs dag la m'a ma k'i gcig pu sbyar na rigs gnyis par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na zhe sdang dang nga rgyal dag dbyer med par byas nas thugs rdo rje dang yid bzhin nor bu'i rigs dag la m'a ma k'i gcig pu sbyar na rigs gnyis par 'gyur /

original: 'o na dbus kyi gtso bo'i reg bya rdo rje ma nyid 'khyud par gnas na de la m'a ma k'is dgos pa ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dbus kyi gtso bo'i reg bya rdo rje ma nyid 'khyud par gnas na de la m'a ma k'is dgos pa ci bya zhe na /

analyzed: smras pa / reg bya rdo rje ma'i rnam grangs can m'a ma k'i kho na yin te skyon med do //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de m'a ma k'i chen mo yin no zhes ming du grags so //

original: padma kha phye zhing bya ba la sogs pas 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs can gyi phyag mtshan bstan te so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi dngos po thams cad rab tu 'byed pas rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: padma kha phye zhing bya ba la sogs pas 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs can gyi phyag mtshan bstan te so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi dngos po thams cad rab tu 'byed pas rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The lotus, opened and so on, is the symbol of the family of AmitƒÅbha, because the thing of the discriminating intuition is expanded by the full development of all things.

original: sprin sngon po ltar zhes pa ni kha dog ljang gu autpala srid pa'i 'jigs pa las grol bar byed pa dam tshig gi rigs kyi phyag mtshan te /
analyzed: sprin sngon po ltar zhes pa ni kha dog ljang gu autpala srid pa'i 'jigs pa las grol bar byed pa dam tshig gi rigs kyi phyag mtshan te /

original: gzugs sdug pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o zhes pa ni rang bzhin skyes pa'i mdzes pa nyid dang sman dang nu ma chen po dang / rked pa phra ba dang mig yangs pa dang ma mchu dmar ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: Endowed with the qualities of a beautiful form, etc. means endowed with the collection of qualities such as the beauty of being naturally born, being a physician, having large breasts, a slender waist, wide eyes, red lips, and so on.

original: lo grangs bcu drug lon pa zhes pa ni gal te gzugs kyi dkyil 'khor du lo bcu gnyis lon pa gsungs pa de bzhin du yang gsung gi dkyil 'khor la mthun pa'i phyag rgya gzung ba bstan te /

translated: Having reached the age of sixteen means that if it is said that one should take a consort who has reached the age of twelve in the mandala of form, then in the mandala of speech, one should take a consort who is suitable.

original: gsung dang sku'i dkyil 'khor dag la thugs kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i phyag rgya gzung ba bzhin no //

translated: Just as in the mandalas of speech and body, one should take a consort as taught in the mandala of mind.

analyzed: dri dang me tog ces bya ba la sogs pas phyi'i yo byad kyis mdzes pa nyid dang ldan par bstan to //
translated: The scent, flower and so forth indicate the possession of beauty by external means.

original: phyag rgya'i mdzes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i mdzes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te //
translated: The beauty of the seal is of two kinds:

original: rang bzhin pa dang byas pa'o //

translated: The latter is impermanent, because it is not pleasing without the former.

original: 'dir gnyis ka yang gzung bar bya'o //

translated: In the middle of that ma·πá·∏çala means that one should visualize the middle of one part of the ma·πá·∏çala ground and enter into union with it.

original: gzhan du dkyil 'khor la gnod par 'gyur te de'i dbus la lhag par mos pa'i yid la byed pas de'i phyogs gcig tu rol par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan du dkyil 'khor la gnod par 'gyur te de'i dbus la lhag par mos pa'i yid la byed pas de'i phyogs gcig tu rol par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Otherwise, it would be harmful to the mandala, because the mind is focused on the center of the mandala. The meaning is that one should play in one part of the mandala.

translated: Blessed as being like MƒÅmakƒ´ means that by the stage of generation, having abandoned the nature of the ordinary, she is emanated as having the nature of MƒÅmakƒ´, which is a synonym for Spar≈õavajrƒÅ. This is the meaning of emanated.

original: rang bzhin gyi tha mal pa'i dngos po bsal te zhes pa ni de nyid kyi don to //üîΩrigs lngas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rigs lnga'i bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa aom la sogs pa'i sa bon de rigs lnga'o //

translated: The pervading is placing them in the five places such as the head.

original: mnyes par byed pa'o zhes pa ni byed pa'i tshogs dgod pa sngon du 'gro bas rol par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyes par byed pa'o zhes pa ni byed pa'i tshogs dgod pa sngon du 'gro bas rol par bya'o //
translated: Please means that one should play with the assembly of agents, having first set them out.

original: yang gi sgra ni nges par bzung ba la'o zhes pa ni nges par bzung na ste gzhan las rnam par gcod pa'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni nges par bzung ba la'o zhes pa ni nges par bzung na ste gzhan las rnam par gcod pa'o //
translated: The word only is for the purpose of exclusion, meaning that one should exclude other things.

original: de nas nges par mnyes par bya ba kho na zhes pa ni gnas pa tsam 'ba' zhig dang / tsumba na dang 'khyud pa tsam dgag par byed de bde ba chen po dang de'i rgyur gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems dam pa rnams kyis mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas nges par mnyes par bya ba kho na zhes pa ni gnas pa tsam 'ba' zhig dang / tsumba na dang 'khyud pa tsam dgag par byed de bde ba chen po dang de'i rgyur gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems dam pa rnams kyis mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Then, only pleasing excludes mere remaining, mere kissing, and mere embracing, because the supreme bliss and the causes of that, the supreme bodhicitta, do not arise.

original: de nyid rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mchog tu blang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mchog tu blang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: That is to be accepted as the best of yogas.

original: de med pas mchod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med pas mchod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Without that, it is not worship.

original: sangs rgyas kun la mnyes byed pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun la mnyes byed pa //
translated: Pleasing all buddhas

original: de ni mchod pa chen por 'dod //üîΩces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mchod pa chen por 'dod //üîΩces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is considered the great worship.

original: zhi ba ni byang chub gyi sems te zhes pa ni zhi ba nyid ni zhi ba ste zla ba'i rang bzhin @214a * //
analyzed: zhi ba ni byang chub gyi sems te zhes pa ni zhi ba nyid ni zhi ba ste zla ba'i rang bzhin @214a * //
translated: Peace is the thought of enlightenment.üîΩPeace itself is peace, the nature of the moon.

original: byang chub sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the thought of enlightenment is the meaning of the thought of enlightenment.

original: spros pa zhes pa'i bshad pa ni rdo rje'i lam nas phyi rol du bya ba'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: spros pa zhes pa'i bshad pa ni rdo rje'i lam nas phyi rol du bya ba'o zhes pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the proliferation is the externalization through the vajra path.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bas mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba myong zhing rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis las 'bab pa'i chu'i rgyun rgyu'i rnam pas byang chub kyi sems 'dzag par
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la 'jug pa sngon du 'gro bas mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba myong zhing rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis las 'bab pa'i chu'i rgyun rgyu'i rnam pas byang chub kyi sems 'dzag par
translated: Having entered all the Tathagatas dwelling in the world systems of the ten directions, one experiences the bliss of supreme joy, and the bodhicitta falling from the seventy-two thousand channels in the form of a stream,

original: 'gyur na rtags lnga 'byung ba'i de ma thag tu bde ba chen po nyams su myong zhing de la rtse gcig pa'i yid kyis 'di ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i phyogs yin gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i phyogs ma yin no zhes rnam par dbyang nas /
analyzed: 'gyur na rtags lnga 'byung ba'i de ma thag tu bde ba chen po nyams su myong zhing de la rtse gcig pa'i yid kyis 'di ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i phyogs yin gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i phyogs ma yin no zhes rnam par dbyang nas /
translated: one should experience the great bliss immediately after the arising of the five signs, and with a mind one-pointed on that, having distinguished, ‚ÄúThis is the side of ultimate truth, not the side of conventional truth,‚Äù

original: sems can gyi don med pas snga ma'i smon lam gyi 'bras bu med bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas rmi lam bzhin du so sor rtog cing rang gi phyag rgya'i chos 'byung gi nang na h'um phat kyi rang bzhin gyi sgras byang chub kyi sems spro bar bya'o
analyzed: sems can gyi don med pas snga ma'i smon lam gyi 'bras bu med bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas rmi lam bzhin du so sor rtog cing rang gi phyag rgya'i chos 'byung gi nang na h'um phat kyi rang bzhin gyi sgras byang chub kyi sems spro bar bya'o
translated: Since there is no benefit to sentient beings, the result of the former aspiration would be nonexistent. Thus, one should imagine that the bodhicitta is emitted by the sound of the nature of H≈™M PHA·π¨ in the inner dharmodaya of one's consort, as in a dream.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: sangs rgyas rab tu 'byung ba zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa ste de las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rab tu 'byung ba zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa ste de las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The emergence of the buddhas is the cause of the generation of all tathƒÅgatas, because all tathƒÅgatas emerge from that.

original: nam mkha'i khams ma lus par brgyan par 'gyur ba zhes pa ni nam mkha'i dbyings ma lus pa brgyan par byed pa de bzhin gshegs pa spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ma lus par brgyan par 'gyur ba zhes pa ni nam mkha'i dbyings ma lus pa brgyan par byed pa de bzhin gshegs pa spro bar bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the ornament of the entire realm of space is the adornment of the entire realm of space, emitting the tathƒÅgatas.

original: 'di skad bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub kyi sems las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub kyi sems las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is taught and so forth. The meaning is that one should meditate on the Tathagata arisen from the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems 'ba' zhig gis mchod par ma zad de zhes pa ni shu kra 'ba' zhig tu dgag pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'ba' zhig gis mchod par ma zad de zhes pa ni shu kra 'ba' zhig tu dgag pa'o //
translated: Not only is there worship with the Thought of Enlightenment alone, and so forth. The meaning is that one should worship with the body also.

original: gzhan yang lus kyi rgyu mthun pas kyang zhes pa ni khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rdzas kyi bdag nyid kyi lus po las 'byung ba mar da we sho mu dang lcags kyu rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan yang lus kyi rgyu mthun pas kyang zhes pa ni khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rdzas kyi bdag nyid kyi lus po las 'byung ba mar da we sho mu dang lcags kyu rnams kyis so //
translated: Moreover, with the body's concordances means with the body's twenty-four elements, which are the substances of the body's origination, the five ambrosias, and the five iron hooks.

original: bdud rtsi lnga zhes pa ni bshad pa la sogs pa rdzas lnga'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga zhes pa ni bshad pa la sogs pa rdzas lnga'o //
translated: The five ambrosias are the five substances of feces and so forth.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la dbul lo zhes pa ni de'i cho ga 'di yin te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la dbul lo zhes pa ni de'i cho ga 'di yin te /
translated: One should offer them to the mandala circle. The meaning is that this is the rite:

original: skyes ma thag pa'i bu chung gis lam lhung ba'i bshang  pa kham phor kha sbyar du gzhag la zhag bdun gyi bar du rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i sngags dang rje btsun yi ge brgya pa dang lhan cig tu mngon bar bzlas la grib ma la skam du
analyzed: skyes ma thag pa'i bu chung gis lam lhung ba'i bshang  pa kham phor kha sbyar du gzhag la zhag bdun gyi bar du rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i sngags dang rje btsun yi ge brgya pa dang lhan cig tu mngon bar bzlas la grib ma la skam du
translated: The fresh feces of a newborn child should be placed in a joined pair of palm-leaf bowls and dried in the sun for seven days, while reciting the mantra of one‚Äôs chosen deity together with the one-hundred-syllable mantra of the Exalted One.

original: bcug la / phyi nas dri bzang dang / shr'i khanda dang / tsandan bsres @214b nas btags te bskyed pa'i rim pas rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs su bskyed la de yongs su gyur pa las slar yang de nyid rdzas su bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bcug la / phyi nas dri bzang dang / shr'i khanda dang / tsandan bsres @214b nas btags te bskyed pa'i rim pas rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs su bskyed la de yongs su gyur pa las slar yang de nyid rdzas su bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, after drying it in the sun, it should be ground with fragrant substances, ≈õrƒ´kha·πá·∏ça, and sandalwood, and by means of the creation stage, it should be created as the form of Vairocana. After that, it should be imagined as the substance itself.

original: de med na rang las byung ba'i mtha' mar ma gyur pa thigs pa gsum tsam blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de med na rang las byung ba'i mtha' mar ma gyur pa thigs pa gsum tsam blang bar bya ste /
translated: If that is not available, one should take three drops from the end of one‚Äôs nose.

original: dang po byung ba'i rags pa'i dri ma ni blang bya ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po byung ba'i rags pa'i dri ma ni blang bya ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the coarse impurity that first arises is not to be taken.

original: de la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ni snga ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa ni snga ma bzhin du'o //
translated: The rite of consecration is as before.

original: dri chu yang tha ma nas byung ba'i thigs pa gsum tsam mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor gyis byin gyis brlabs te blang ngo //
analyzed: dri chu yang tha ma nas byung ba'i thigs pa gsum tsam mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor gyis byin gyis brlabs te blang ngo //
translated: Also, the urine is the three drops that come at the end, which are blessed by the yoga of Ak·π£obhya and are to be taken.

original: khrag kyang lo bcu gnyis lon pa'i bu mo'i rang byung ba'i me tog blang bar bya ste med na g-yon pa'i srin lag las byung ba'i rin chen 'byung ldan gyi bskyed pa'i rim pas byin gyis brlabs nas blang ngo //
analyzed: khrag kyang lo bcu gnyis lon pa'i bu mo'i rang byung ba'i me tog blang bar bya ste med na g-yon pa'i srin lag las byung ba'i rin chen 'byung ldan gyi bskyed pa'i rim pas byin gyis brlabs nas blang ngo //
translated: Also, the blood is the naturally arisen flower of a twelve-year-old girl, which is to be taken. If that is not available, it is blessed by the generation stage of Ratnasambhava and is to be taken from the left ring finger.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyang zla ba gzas zin pa'i dus su dbang po gnyis snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba sa lam ltung ba dung phor gyis blangs te gsung rdo rje'i rnal 'byor gyis byin gyis brlab pa'o //

translated: Also, the bodhicitta is that which arises from the union of the two organs at the time of the moon‚Äôs eclipse. It is to be taken with a conch cup and blessed by the yoga of Vajra Speech.

original: zla ba gzas zin dus su ni //
analyzed: zla ba gzas zin dus su ni //
translated: At the time of the moon‚Äôs eclipse,

original: kha ru bcug ste 'dzin par bya //
analyzed: kha ru bcug ste 'dzin par bya //
translated: it is placed in the mouth and held.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: la la na re thur du sel ba'i rlung gyen du drangs nas rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor mas ngag gi lam nas phyung ba blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: la la na re thur du sel ba'i rlung gyen du drangs nas rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor mas ngag gi lam nas phyung ba blang bar bya'o //
translated: Some say that one should draw up the downward-voiding wind and take it out through the path of the mouth of the yogin or yoginƒ´.

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyis byin gyis brlab pa yang de nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyis byin gyis brlab pa yang de nyid la bya'o //
translated: One should also consecrate it with AmitƒÅbha.

original: sha chen po yang dpal rdo rje bdud rtsi'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho gas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: sha chen po yang dpal rdo rje bdud rtsi'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i cho gas blang bar bya ste /
translated: One should also take the great flesh by the rite taught in the glorious Vajra-Am·πõta Tantra.

original: de la re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas dpal rdo rje he ru ka'i bdag nyid bsgoms la /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas dpal rdo rje he ru ka'i bdag nyid bsgoms la /
translated: There, the yogin first meditates on the nature of glorious Vajraheruka.

original: keng rus la sogs pa 'jigs pa'i dur khrod kyi phyogs su phyin nas de la lang tsho dang ldan pa lo bcu drug pa so sum cu rtsa gnyis tshang ba /
analyzed: keng rus la sogs pa 'jigs pa'i dur khrod kyi phyogs su phyin nas de la lang tsho dang ldan pa lo bcu drug pa so sum cu rtsa gnyis tshang ba /
translated: Then, in a terrifying charnel ground with skeletons and so on, one should go there and take the flesh of a young person, sixteen years old, with all thirty-two teeth.

analyzed: de la khyab par byed pa ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa stong pa nyid du grags pa'o //
translated: There, the universal is the aggregate of form, etc., known as emptiness.

original: nyi tshe ba ni so sor nges pa nyid kyis rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba ni so sor nges pa nyid kyis rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The limited is the characteristic of Vairocana, etc. , by the determination of each.

original: 'dir ni gnyis ka yang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni gnyis ka yang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Here both are to be taken.

original: mdor bsdus pas ni phung po lnga //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas ni phung po lnga //
translated: By the brief, the five aggregates

original: sangs rgyas lngar ni rab tu grags //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lngar ni rab tu grags //
translated: are renowned as the five Buddhas.

original: rdo rje skye mched nyid dag kyang //
analyzed: rdo rje skye mched nyid dag kyang //
translated: The pure sense-fields of the vajra

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor mchog / ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor mchog / ces 'byung ngo //
translated: are the supreme mandala of the Bodhisattvas.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //üîΩmig la sogs pa'i skye mched de //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir // mig la sogs pa'i skye mched de //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe sense-fields of the eye, etc. ‚Äù

original: grags pa che zhing zhes pa ni mngon par shes pa'i ye shes thob pa'o //
analyzed: grags pa che zhing zhes pa ni mngon par shes pa'i ye shes thob pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOf great renown‚Äù means having attained the knowledge of the superknowledges.

original: @216b spyod pa bzang po de rnams zhes pa ni skad cig tsam gyis bskal pa'i dngos po rnams mthong ba la gzhol ba'o //
analyzed: @216b spyod pa bzang po de rnams zhes pa ni skad cig tsam gyis bskal pa'i dngos po rnams mthong ba la gzhol ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose of good conduct‚Äù means those who are intent on seeing things of the eon in an instant.

original: mnyes shing zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gro ba'i mig la bde ba ster bar 'gyur te chog mi shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyes shing zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gro ba'i mig la bde ba ster bar 'gyur te chog mi shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúGratified‚Äù and so forth means that they will bestow happiness on the eyes of the world, because they are insatiable.

original: de dus brtsams nas de ni rtog med pa //
analyzed: de dus brtsams nas de ni rtog med pa //
translated: From that time on, it is non-conceptual.

original: de yi dbyibs dang kha dog mtshan ci bzhin //
analyzed: de yi dbyibs dang kha dog mtshan ci bzhin //
translated: It has the same shape, color, and characteristics as that.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab rnam par smin pa'i sku //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab rnam par smin pa'i sku //
translated: The inconceivable body of evolution

original: sdom pa de las bya ba byas pas thob //
analyzed: sdom pa de las bya ba byas pas thob //
translated: is attained from that vow by the performance of action.

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And likewise:

original: mi bskyod bsten pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: mi bskyod bsten pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogi who relies on Akshobhya

original: nad rnams kun dang bral bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nad rnams kun dang bral bar 'gyur //
translated: becomes free from all disease.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i rgyud las gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i rgyud las gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said in the explanatory tantra.

original: drang ba'i don to zhes pa ni //
analyzed: drang ba'i don to zhes pa ni //
translated: The meaning of the words is to be understood as follows:

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa gtso bor gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa gtso bor gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúinterpretable‚Äù is that the mandala is taught primarily in terms of the creation stage.

original: lung gi bshad pa brjod par bya ba zhes pas dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyi ye shes ni dkyil 'khor lta bur snang ngo zhes bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: lung gi bshad pa brjod par bya ba zhes pas dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyi ye shes ni dkyil 'khor lta bur snang ngo zhes bstan par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúto be expressed by the explanation of scripture‚Äù is that the reality of the characteristics of the purity of the mandala is to be taught, and so it is said that one‚Äôs own intuition appears like a mandala.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni sdud pa po'i tshig go //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni sdud pa po'i tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúThen‚Äù is the word of the compiler.

original: thugs kyang yin la thugs nyid dkyil 'khor yin pas thugs kyi dkyil 'khor de las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: thugs kyang yin la thugs nyid dkyil 'khor yin pas thugs kyi dkyil 'khor de las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: And since the mind is the very mandala, it is the mandala of the mind.

original: 'dir rang bzhin gyis sam rnam par dag pa'i rim pas dag pa'i sems gang yin pa de nyid snying po len pas na dkyil 'khor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rang bzhin gyis sam rnam par dag pa'i rim pas dag pa'i sems gang yin pa de nyid snying po len pas na dkyil 'khor zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the mind that is pure by nature or by the process of purification is the very essence that is taken up, and so it is called the mandala.

original: rdo rje ye shes ni ye shes lnga ste de dang 'dra ba ni de'i rang bzhin te de'i bdag nyid du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje ye shes ni ye shes lnga ste de dang 'dra ba ni de'i rang bzhin te de'i bdag nyid du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Vajra wisdom is the five wisdoms, and that which is similar to that is its nature. The meaning is that it is engaged in the nature of that.

original: lus la sogs pa tha mal pa'i ngo bo spangs nas 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa gang yin pa de nyid thugs kyi ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba'i snying po len pas na sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa tha mal pa'i ngo bo spangs nas 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa gang yin pa de nyid thugs kyi ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba'i snying po len pas na sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the mandala of body, speech, and mind is that the very essence that is taken up is the nature of the mind, which is the abandonment of the ordinary nature of the body and so forth and the transformation into the nature of luminosity.

original: gzhan yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is it like?

original: 'di ni dgu'i bdag nyid ces pa ni snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang snang ba nye bar thob pa dang stong pa dang shin du stong pa dang stong pa chen po dang shes rab dang thabs dang ma rig pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dgu'i bdag nyid ces pa ni snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang snang ba nye bar thob pa dang stong pa dang shin du stong pa dang stong pa chen po dang shes rab dang thabs dang ma rig pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: means the nature of appearance, increase of appearance, close-to-attainment appearance, emptiness, utter emptiness, great emptiness, wisdom, method, and ignorance.

original: yang na gsung rab yan lag dgu pa'i rang bzhin zhes kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: yang na gsung rab yan lag dgu pa'i rang bzhin zhes kha cig zer ro //
translated: Or, it is the nature of the nine branches of scripture, some say.

original: de'i phyir mchog yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mchog yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is supreme.

original: sna tshogs lung gi brdar gyur pa //
analyzed: sna tshogs lung gi brdar gyur pa //
translated: The various scriptures are its symbols.

original: zhes pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i lung gis nye bar mtshon pa'i sems zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde la sems ni gcig yin te nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs sna tshogs pa'i @217a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i lung gis nye bar mtshon pa'i sems zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de la sems ni gcig yin te nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs sna tshogs pa'i @217a * //
translated: This means the mind that is illustrated by the various scriptures.

original: gdul bya'i dbang gis ngo bo tha dad par snang ste /
analyzed: gdul bya'i dbang gis ngo bo tha dad par snang ste /
translated: There, the mind is one, but due to the various types of disciples such as the sravakas, it appears as different natures.

original: ngo bo snang ba thams cad sems kyi me long la gzugs brnyan du snang ste /
analyzed: ngo bo snang ba thams cad sems kyi me long la gzugs brnyan du snang ste /
translated: All natures appear as reflections in the mirror of the mind,

original: shel gyi nor bu la sngon po la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shel gyi nor bu la sngon po la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a crystal jewel and blue, and so on.

original: lha rnams la ni dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: lha rnams la ni dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the object of the gods,

original: sems can mos pa sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: sems can mos pa sna tshogs pa //
translated: the various aspirations of sentient beings,

original: sems rdo rje las rnam grol ba'i ;
analyzed: sems rdo rje las rnam grol ba'i ;
translated: the liberation of the mind from the vajra,

original: / lha gzhan grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / lha gzhan grub pa ma yin no //
translated: the accomplishment of other gods is not so.

original: sems kyi byang chub rnyed bya ba //
analyzed: sems kyi byang chub rnyed bya ba //
translated: The mind is to be found in enlightenment,

original: sems kyis 'gro ba lngar 'gro ba //
analyzed: sems kyis 'gro ba lngar 'gro ba //
translated: the mind goes to the five migrations,

original: sems las ma gtogs kha cig ni //
analyzed: sems las ma gtogs kha cig ni //
translated: apart from the mind there is nothing,

original: bde dang sdug bsngal mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal mtshan nyid med //
translated: and there is no characteristic of pleasure and pain.

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: kun rdzob ni btags pa'i tshul du so sor snang ba ste dngos po'i tshigs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob ni btags pa'i tshul du so sor snang ba ste dngos po'i tshigs so //
translated: The conventional is the appearance of the individual modes of designation, the mode of things.

original: dod na dam pa ni dngos po thams cad kyi chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid de stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dod na dam pa ni dngos po thams cad kyi chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid de stong pa nyid do //
translated: The ultimate is the characteristic of the reality of all things, which is emptiness.

original: rnam par rtog pa gzhan med pa //üîΩrnam par rtog pa kun rdzob bshad //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzhan med pa // rnam par rtog pa kun rdzob bshad //
translated: There is no other conceptualization,üîΩconceptualization is said to be conventional,

original: rnam par rtog pa ldog pa yin //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ldog pa yin //
translated: the cessation of conceptualization

original: don dam pa ni de nyid yin //
analyzed: don dam pa ni de nyid yin //
translated: is the ultimate.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: kun rdzob dang ni don dam pa de dag phan tshun med par mi 'byung bas 'jug pa yin te //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang ni don dam pa de dag phan tshun med par mi 'byung bas 'jug pa yin te //
translated: The conventional and the ultimate are mutually non-existent and do not occur without each other.

original: 'phags pa brgyad stong pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin ma las /üîΩji skad du /
analyzed: 'phags pa brgyad stong pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin ma las / ji skad du /
translated: The noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines says,üîΩ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, form is empty by its very nature, and emptiness is form.

original: rab 'byor gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid dang / gzugs kyang stong pa nyid dang // stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so //üîΩgzugs las stong pa nyid tha dad pa ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid dang / gzugs kyang stong pa nyid dang // stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so // gzugs las stong pa nyid tha dad pa ma yin /
translated: Emptiness is not one thing, and form another.

original: stong pa nyid las kyang gzugs tha dad pa ma yin te //
analyzed: stong pa nyid las kyang gzugs tha dad pa ma yin te //
translated: Form is not one thing, and emptiness another.

original: gnyis su med pa rnam pa gnyis med pa bcad du med pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa rnam pa gnyis med pa bcad du med pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: There is no division, no differentiation.‚Äù

original: klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang //
analyzed: klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says,

original: med par mi 'byung nges pa ni //üîΩbyas dang mi rtag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: med par mi 'byung nges pa ni // byas dang mi rtag pa bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is certain that without the existent, the nonexistent does not occur,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: like the produced and impermanence.‚Äù

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa de dag sems gang la dbyer med par snang ba de gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa de dag sems gang la dbyer med par snang ba de gnyis pa ste /
translated: The mind in which those two, the conventional and the ultimate, appear as inseparable is the second,

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bos mdzes pa zhes bstan te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bos mdzes pa zhes bstan te /
translated: which is taught as ‚Äúadorned with the essence of nondual wisdom,‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from the stains of the two kinds of conceptualization.

original: yang na kun rdzob ni ye shes kyi sku ste /
analyzed: yang na kun rdzob ni ye shes kyi sku ste /
translated: Or else, the conventional is the body of intuition,

original: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas so //
translated: by the stage of self-consecration.

original: don dam pa ni 'od gsal ba ste //
analyzed: don dam pa ni 'od gsal ba ste //
translated: The ultimate is clearlight transparency,

original: mngon par byang chub kyi rim pas so //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub kyi rim pas so //
translated: by the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: de dag gnyis su med pa'i zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i rdo rje'i sku ste /
analyzed: de dag gnyis su med pa'i zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i rdo rje'i sku ste /
translated: The vajra-body to be attained by the stage of union of those two,

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: is the nature of the realm of non-abiding nirvana.

original: de nyid mdzes pa ni bskal pa'am bskal pa stong gi bar du sems can gyi don mdzad pa la brtson pas so //
analyzed: de nyid mdzes pa ni bskal pa'am bskal pa stong gi bar du sems can gyi don mdzad pa la brtson pas so //
translated: It is beautiful, because it is intent on working for the welfare of sentient beings for an eon or a thousand eons.

original: shes rab 'di ni thig @217b yin te //
analyzed: shes rab 'di ni thig @217b yin te //
translated: This wisdom is the line,

original: zhes pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin so sor rtog par byed pa'i bdag nyid can gyi blo ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin so sor rtog par byed pa'i bdag nyid can gyi blo ni shes rab bo //
translated: The mind which has the nature of discerning the emptiness of all things is wisdom.

original: de nyid thig btab pa yin te khams gsum pa sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gnyis so //
analyzed: de nyid thig btab pa yin te khams gsum pa sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gnyis so //
translated: That is the line, because it is the two, the world of sentient beings and the world of the container, the three realms.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyis mtshon pas so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyis mtshon pas so //
translated: It is indicated by its nature.

original: chad pa'i phyogs spang bar bya ba'i don du thabs ni de'i rjes su 'jug pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: chad pa'i phyogs spang bar bya ba'i don du thabs ni de'i rjes su 'jug pa zhes smos te /
translated: The means is mentioned as ‚Äúengaged in that‚Äù for the purpose of abandoning the extreme of nihilism.

original: 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byed pa'i snying rje chen po ni thabs so //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byed pa'i snying rje chen po ni thabs so //
translated: Great compassion, which acts for the welfare of all beings without exception, is the means.

original: de la rjes su 'jug pa ni ldang ba'o //
analyzed: de la rjes su 'jug pa ni ldang ba'o //
translated: Engagement in that is the rising.

original: shes rab ces bya ba ni thig gdab pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab ces bya ba ni thig gdab pa yin te /
translated: The ‚Äúwisdom‚Äù is the line.

original: shes rab dang snying rje dag gis sems can gyi don 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje dag gis sems can gyi don 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the welfare of sentient beings is accomplished by means of wisdom and compassion.

original: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa zhes pa ni sku gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor te thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa zhes pa ni sku gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor te thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The ‚Äúdharma and enjoyment bodies‚Äù are the ma·πá·∏çala of the nature of the two bodies, the mind ma·πá·∏çala.

original: de la zag pa med pa shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa'i rang bzhin ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku nyid do //
analyzed: de la zag pa med pa shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa'i rang bzhin ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku nyid do //
translated: The uncontaminated nature of the perfection of wisdom is the dharma body of the buddhas.

original: de nyid sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pa'i phyir mtshan dang dpe byed kyis mdzes pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de nyid sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pa'i phyir mtshan dang dpe byed kyis mdzes pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: In order to perform the welfare of sentient beings, that very [dharma body] is beautified by the major and minor marks, the enjoyment body.

original: shes rab thabs kyi thig gcig gis //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi thig gcig gis //
translated: The single line of wisdom and method

original: zhes pa ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje gtsor gyur pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje gtsor gyur pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyis so //
translated: This is the mental continuum that is primarily emptiness and compassion.

original: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor thig gdab bya //
analyzed: thugs kyi dkyil 'khor thig gdab bya //
translated: The mandala of mind is to be laid out.

original: zhes pa ni de'i bag chags dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rgyud bya ba gang yin pa de ni thig btab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de'i bag chags dang ldan pa'i sems kyi rgyud bya ba gang yin pa de ni thig btab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the mental continuum that is endowed with the latent tendencies of that, which is called ‚Äúthe laid out mandala.‚Äù

original: rten 'brel yan lag bcu gnyis pa //
analyzed: rten 'brel yan lag bcu gnyis pa //
translated: The twelve links of dependent origination.

original: zhes pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows:

original: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang /
translated: Ignorance, formation, consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth,

original: rga ba dang / shi ba'o //
analyzed: rga ba dang / shi ba'o //
translated: aging, and death.

original: de rnams las dang po dang brgyad pa dang dgu ba ni nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams las dang po dang brgyad pa dang dgu ba ni nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Among these, the first, eighth, and ninth are afflictions.

original: gnyis pa dang bcu pa ni las so //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang bcu pa ni las so //
translated: The second and tenth are karma.

original: lhag ma bdun ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: lhag ma bdun ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The remaining seven are suffering.

original: gsum po de dag gis bsdus pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyis 'gro ba 'di nyid yongs su 'khor te 'khrul 'khor bzhin no //
analyzed: gsum po de dag gis bsdus pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyis 'gro ba 'di nyid yongs su 'khor te 'khrul 'khor bzhin no //
translated: This world is completely turned by these three, like a wheel.

original: de la dbang phyug la sogs pa byed pa po kha cig yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la dbang phyug la sogs pa byed pa po kha cig yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, there is no creator such as a God, etc.

original: gang gis 'di sprul par bya ba yin /
analyzed: gang gis 'di sprul par bya ba yin /
translated: By whom is this world created?

original: yan lag bcu gnyis pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi srid pa 'khor lo 'di mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gang gis sbyang bar bya ba de ni sems nyid khru bcu gnyis pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes @218a * //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyi srid pa 'khor lo 'di mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gang gis sbyang bar bya ba de ni sems nyid khru bcu gnyis pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes @218a * //
translated: This wheel of existence, which has the nature of the twelve members of dependent origination, is seen by the path of cultivation, which is purified by the path of vision.

original: bya'o ; / bden pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: bya'o ; / bden pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: The truth is fourfold:

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo //
translated: suffering, origination, cessation, and the path.

original: de la 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa gnyis dang / 'phags pa rang gi bden pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa gnyis dang / 'phags pa rang gi bden pa gnyis so //
translated: Here, there are two truths of the noble ones and two truths of the individual.

original: de la sdug bsngal ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ste 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ste 'bras bu'o //
translated: Here, suffering is the five appropriated aggregates, which are the result.

original: kun 'byung ni ma rig pa dang srid pa ste rgyu'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ni ma rig pa dang srid pa ste rgyu'o //
translated: The origin is ignorance and becoming, which are the causes.

original: 'gog pa ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Cessation is the characteristic of being free from afflictions.

original: lam ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: lam ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The path is fivefold:

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: de rnam par dag par byed pa sems nyid ni bzhi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnam par dag par byed pa sems nyid ni bzhi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the four mental states that purify that is the meaning of the four.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi zhes pa ni byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms so //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi zhes pa ni byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms so //
translated: The four divine abodes are loving-kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de la sems can thams cad bde ba dang ldan par gyur cig ces bsam pa gang yin pa de ni byams pa ste /
analyzed: de la sems can thams cad bde ba dang ldan par gyur cig ces bsam pa gang yin pa de ni byams pa ste /
translated: Among them, the thought May all sentient beings possess happiness is loving-kindness.

original: rnam par snang ba dang khro ba la sogs pa ldog par byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: rnam par snang ba dang khro ba la sogs pa ldog par byed pa'i las can no //
translated: It has the function of turning away from anger, hatred, and so on.

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams sdug bsngal dang bral bar gyur cig ces bsam pa ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams sdug bsngal dang bral bar gyur cig ces bsam pa ni snying rje'o //
translated: The thought May sentient beings who possess suffering be free from suffering is compassion.

original: bsod nams can gyi sems can rnams kyi dge ba la rjes su yi rang ba'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams can gyi sems can rnams kyi dge ba la rjes su yi rang ba'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba'o //
translated: The thought of sympathetic joy is the joy in the virtue of those sentient beings who have merit.

original: bsod nams med pa'i sems can rnams la khrod khro ba dang rjes su chags pa dang bral ba'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: bsod nams med pa'i sems can rnams la khrod khro ba dang rjes su chags pa dang bral ba'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni btang snyoms so //
translated: The thought of equanimity is the thought free from anger and attachment toward those sentient beings who have no merit.

original: de rnam par dag pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i sems nyid grva bzhi yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i sems nyid grva bzhi yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mind of the yogi who has purified those is the four corners.üîΩAs it is said, ‚ÄúThe mind is purified by the meditation that has as its object love, compassion, sympathetic joy, equanimity, happiness, suffering, merit, and demerit.‚Äù

original: ji skad du byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang bsod nams dang bsod nams med pa'i yul can bsgom pas sems dag par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji skad du byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang bsod nams dang bsod nams med pa'i yul can bsgom pas sems dag par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And it is said,

original: bsam gtan tshad med gzugs med pas //üîΩtshangs pa la sogs bde thob 'gyur //
analyzed: bsam gtan tshad med gzugs med pas // tshangs pa la sogs bde thob 'gyur //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the dhyanas, the immeasurables, and the formless states,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: one attains the bliss of Brahma and so on.‚Äù

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po grangs ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po grangs ni bzhi ste /
translated: The number of the means of gathering is four.

original: sbyin pa dang / tshig snyan pa dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshig snyan pa dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa'o //
translated: generosity, pleasant speech, meaningful activity, and consistency between words and deeds.

original: yan lag bzhi po de dag gi rnal 'byor pas sems can rnams bsdu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi po de dag gi rnal 'byor pas sems can rnams bsdu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The practitioner gathers beings through these four limbs.

original: longs spyod 'dod pa la ni sbyin pas bsdus so //
analyzed: longs spyod 'dod pa la ni sbyin pas bsdus so //
translated: Those who desire wealth are gathered through generosity.

original: nga rgyal dang ldan pa dang zhe sdang dang bcas pa la ni tshig snyan pas so //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang ldan pa dang zhe sdang dang bcas pa la ni tshig snyan pas so //
translated: Those who are proud and those who are angry are gathered through pleasant speech.

original: gti mug dang ldan pa la ni don spyod pas so //
analyzed: gti mug dang ldan pa la ni don spyod pas so //
translated: Those who are confused are gathered through meaningful activity.

original: de dag thams cad la ni don mthun pas so //
analyzed: de dag thams cad la ni don mthun pas so //
translated: All of them are gathered through consistency between words and deeds.

original: rnam par dag pa de nyid kyis rnal 'byor pa'i @218b sems nyid ni sgo bzhi yin te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa de nyid kyis rnal 'byor pa'i @218b sems nyid ni sgo bzhi yin te /
translated: The practitioner's mind itself is the four doors, due to that very purity.

original: gang gi phyir sgo nas ji ltar srog chags rnams khang pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa de bzhin du bsdu ba'i dngos po'i sgo nas thar pa'i grong khyer la sems can rnams 'jug pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgo nas ji ltar srog chags rnams khang pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa de bzhin du bsdu ba'i dngos po'i sgo nas thar pa'i grong khyer la sems can rnams 'jug pa la 'jug go //
translated: Just as living beings enter a house, etc. through a door, in the same way, through the door of the means of gathering, beings enter the city of liberation.

original: re re ni bsdu ba'i dngos po re re'i grangs kyis bzhi'i ming can ni sgo bzhi po'i ming gi tha snyad du bya'o //
analyzed: re re ni bsdu ba'i dngos po re re'i grangs kyis bzhi'i ming can ni sgo bzhi po'i ming gi tha snyad du bya'o //
translated: Each one is the name of one of the four doors, by the number of each of the four means of conversion.

original: chos ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Dharma is conventional truth.

original: de nyid don ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid don ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: That itself is the meaning, ultimate truth.

original: de dag dbyer med pa ste zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nas brda ste ming can no //
analyzed: de dag dbyer med pa ste zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nas brda ste ming can no //
translated: Those are the indivisible, the union, the door of samadhi, the name.

original: 'khor lo'i nang gi dkyil 'khor ro zhes pa ni snying po'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ste kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen po'i de kho na nyid ni nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa so sor snang ba ste sems
analyzed: 'khor lo'i nang gi dkyil 'khor ro zhes pa ni snying po'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ste kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen po'i de kho na nyid ni nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa so sor snang ba ste sems
translated: The mandala in the center of the wheel is the mandala of the essence, the nature of the indivisible conventional and ultimate, the reality of Great Vajradhara, appearing as the individual forms of the inner mandala.

original: nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúmind‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúcitta.‚Äù

original: mi byed ye shes mtshan ma ste //
analyzed: mi byed ye shes mtshan ma ste //
translated: The sign of non-action is wisdom.

original: zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature of the wisdom of the dharmadhatu.

original: rdo rje aindra n'i la rgya //
analyzed: rdo rje aindra n'i la rgya //
translated: Vajra is the color of sapphire.

original: zhes pa la dbus su mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya gang yin pa de ni sems nyid do zhes bya ba'i don te//
analyzed: zhes pa la dbus su mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya gang yin pa de ni sems nyid do zhes bya ba'i don te//
translated: The meaning of this is that the seal of Akshobhya in the center is the mind itself.

original: mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin ye shes de nyid sems te de'i rnam pa lnga nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin ye shes de nyid sems te de'i rnam pa lnga nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that very indivisible nature of intuition as the mind, and its five aspects,üîΩit is said:

original: rnam pa lnga yi dbye bar bshad //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga yi dbye bar bshad //
translated: It is explained as the fivefold division.

original: ces smos te sems nyid gang yin pa de nyid me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin te dri ma rnams glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces smos te sems nyid gang yin pa de nyid me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin te dri ma rnams glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind itself is the nature of the five intuitions such as the mirror intuition, because the stains are adventitious.

original: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' ni //
analyzed: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' ni //
translated: The water element, gold, and space

original: dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //üîΩces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: are accepted as pure like the pure.

original: ye shes lnga ni kun gzhi la sogs pa rnam par shes pa lnga'i gnyen po'i phyogs yin pas rtse mo 'khor ba 'jigs byed pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes lnga ni kun gzhi la sogs pa rnam par shes pa lnga'i gnyen po'i phyogs yin pas rtse mo 'khor ba 'jigs byed pa'o //
translated: The five intuitions are the antidote side of the five consciousnesses such as the fundamental consciousness, and so they are the peak of cyclic existence, the destroyer of cyclic existence.

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal

original: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa'o //
translated: is the mind and mental factors of the three realms.

original: zhes 'byung ngo// rgyud phyi ma las kyang //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo// rgyud phyi ma las kyang //
translated: And the Later Tantra says:

original: spang bya lnga dang rig pa lnga //
analyzed: spang bya lnga dang rig pa lnga //
translated: The five things to be abandoned and the five awarenesses

original: rdo rje zhes ni bshad pa yin //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes ni bshad pa yin //
translated: are explained as the vajra.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: From the east, etc.

original: shar nas zhes bya la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad kyi mtshan ma 'bar ba dang bcas pa'i 'khor lo gang yin pa de ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: shar nas zhes bya la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad kyi mtshan ma 'bar ba dang bcas pa'i 'khor lo gang yin pa de ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya ste /
translated: The wheel that is the sign of Vairochana, together with its blazing, should be known as the nature of mirror-like awareness.

original: de bas na rnal 'byor pa'i sems la bsgom pa'i dus su sa dang por mthong ba'i lam gyi me long lta bu'i ye shes 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na rnal 'byor pa'i sems la bsgom pa'i dus su sa dang por mthong ba'i lam gyi me long lta bu'i ye shes 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when the yogin's mind is meditating, the mirror-like awareness of the path of seeing will arise on the first stage.

original: de bas na phyi rol du yang shar phyogs su de nyid rnam par dgod par bya'o //üîΩde bzhin du lho ru zhes bya ba la sogs pas lho phyogs su yid bzhin nor bu rin chen gang @219a * //
analyzed: de bas na phyi rol du yang shar phyogs su de nyid rnam par dgod par bya'o // de bzhin du lho ru zhes bya ba la sogs pas lho phyogs su yid bzhin nor bu rin chen gang @219a * //
translated: Therefore, externally also, that should be placed in the east.üîΩSimilarly, in the south, etc.

original: yin pa de ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin te sems nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: yin pa de ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin te sems nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The wish-fulfilling jewel that is in the south should be known as the nature of the awareness of equality, which is the realization of the mind itself.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi sa gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa la de nyid khams gsum pa dang dbyer med pa'i snang bas so //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi sa gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa la de nyid khams gsum pa dang dbyer med pa'i snang bas so //
translated: On the second, third, and fourth spiritual levels of the path of cultivation, it is by the light of the indivisibility of the three realms.

original: de bas na rin thang med pa dang / dkon pas na de nyid rin po che zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rin thang med pa dang / dkon pas na de nyid rin po che zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because it is priceless and rare, it is called a jewel.

original: nub tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas nub kyi phyogs su ngag gi dbang phyug gi mtshan ma padma gang yin pa de ni kun du so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sems nyid du shes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: nub tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas nub kyi phyogs su ngag gi dbang phyug gi mtshan ma padma gang yin pa de ni kun du so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sems nyid du shes par bya ba ste /
translated: In the west, etc. The sign of VƒÅgƒ´≈õvara, which is a lotus in the western direction, should be known as the mind which is the nature of the discriminating pristine awareness,

original: sa lnga pa dang drug pa dang bdun pa la khams gsum yang dag par so sor rtog pa'i bdag nyid du skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa lnga pa dang drug pa dang bdun pa la khams gsum yang dag par so sor rtog pa'i bdag nyid du skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is born as the nature of the correct discrimination of the three realms on the fifth, sixth, and seventh spiritual levels.

original: byang du zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang phyogs su ral gri gang yin pa de ni khams gsum gyi yul gyi rnam par rtog pa gcod par byed pas na bya ba nan tan grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: byang du zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang phyogs su ral gri gang yin pa de ni khams gsum gyi yul gyi rnam par rtog pa gcod par byed pas na bya ba nan tan grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi sems nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: In the north and so on indicates that the sword in the north should be known as the nature of the mind of successful activities, because it cuts the conceptualization of objects of the three realms.

original: sa brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang // bcu pa la kun gzhi gnas su gyur pa dang / las kyi dbang dang ye shes kyi dbang gis rang bzhin de skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang // bcu pa la kun gzhi gnas su gyur pa dang / las kyi dbang dang ye shes kyi dbang gis rang bzhin de skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because on the eighth, ninth, and tenth stages, the foundation consciousness is transformed, and the nature of that is produced by the power of karma and the power of wisdom.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can gyi don mdzad kyang /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can gyi don mdzad kyang /
translated: The Bhagavan Buddhas who have entered nonconceptual concentration accomplish the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams ni mi dmigs te //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni mi dmigs te //
translated: But sentient beings are not observed.

original: skyes bu yid bzhin nor bu bzhin //
analyzed: skyes bu yid bzhin nor bu bzhin //
translated: Like a wish-fulfilling jewel,

original: de yi phrad pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: de yi phrad pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: merely by encountering it,

original: rtsig pa la sogs rnams las kyang //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs rnams las kyang //
translated: from walls and so on,

original: ji bzhin bstan pa rnams 'byung ngo //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji bzhin bstan pa rnams 'byung ngo //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
translated: teachings arise just as they are.

original: shar lho zhes bya ba la sogs pa la me'i mtshams su sangs rgyas spyan ma'i mtshan ma mig gang yin pa de ni dga' ba dang sbyor ba'i 'dod pa mthong ba'i rang bzhin tshangs pa'i gnas byams pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo rang gi sems nyid du shes
analyzed: shar lho zhes bya ba la sogs pa la me'i mtshams su sangs rgyas spyan ma'i mtshan ma mig gang yin pa de ni dga' ba dang sbyor ba'i 'dod pa mthong ba'i rang bzhin tshangs pa'i gnas byams pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo rang gi sems nyid du shes
translated: In the southeast, etc., the eye, which is the sign of Buddhalocana in the southeast, is the nature of seeing the desire of the joy and application Brahma-vihƒÅra called ‚Äúlove.‚ÄùüîΩOne should know it as one‚Äôs own mind.

original: par bya'o // lho nub ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bden bral gyi mtshams su m'a ma k'i'i mtshan ma rdo rje gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal ba dang bral bar 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid tshangs pa'i gnas snying rje zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin rnal 'byor pa'i sems nyid
analyzed: par bya'o // lho nub ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bden bral gyi mtshams su m'a ma k'i'i mtshan ma rdo rje gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal ba dang bral bar 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid tshangs pa'i gnas snying rje zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin rnal 'byor pa'i sems nyid
translated: In the southwest, etc., the vajra, which is the sign of MƒÅmakƒ´ in the southwest, is the nature of the Brahma-vihƒÅra called ‚Äúcompassion,‚Äù which has the characteristic of the desire to free from suffering.

original: du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: du shes par bya ste /
translated: One should know it as the yogin‚Äôs own mind.

original: sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo rnams gzhom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo rnams gzhom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is for the purpose of destroying the entities of suffering.

original: nub byang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rlung gi mtshams su gos dkar mo'i mtshan ma padma gang yin pa de ni sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i spyod pa rjes su yi rang ba'i mtshan nyid @219b tshangs pa'i gnas dga' ba zhes bya ba'i ngo bo
analyzed: nub byang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rlung gi mtshams su gos dkar mo'i mtshan ma padma gang yin pa de ni sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i spyod pa rjes su yi rang ba'i mtshan nyid @219b tshangs pa'i gnas dga' ba zhes bya ba'i ngo bo
translated: In the northwest, etc. means that in the wind quarter, the sign of PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´ which is a lotus, is the nature of the mind which is the nature of the abode of BrahmƒÅ called ‚Äújoy‚Äù which is the characteristic of rejoicing in the virtuous conduct of all sentient beings.

original: sems nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sems nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as the mind itself.

original: padma kha phye ba ni dga' ba dang ldan pa'i bde ba rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: padma kha phye ba ni dga' ba dang ldan pa'i bde ba rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the opened lotus is the expansion of the bliss endowed with joy.

original: byang shar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbang ldan gyi mtshams su bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma'i mtshan ma autpala sngon po gang yin pa de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i dri ma gnyis dang bral ba btang snyoms kyi ngo bo'i sems nyid de /
analyzed: byang shar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbang ldan gyi mtshams su bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma'i mtshan ma autpala sngon po gang yin pa de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i dri ma gnyis dang bral ba btang snyoms kyi ngo bo'i sems nyid de /
translated: In the northeast, etc. means that in the Indra quarter, the sign of Bhagavatƒ´ TƒÅrƒÅ which is a blue lotus, is the nature of the mind which is the nature of equanimity free from the two stains of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: autpala bzhin du 'dam las byung na yang de'i skyon gyis mi gos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: autpala bzhin du 'dam las byung na yang de'i skyon gyis mi gos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like a lotus, although it arises from mud, it is not soiled by its faults.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi don dang ldan pa'i ming can sngar bshad pa gang yin pa de dag shar la sogs pa'i sgo bzhi la gnas pa 'phags pa gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa khro bo'i rgyal po bzhi'i mtshan
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi don dang ldan pa'i ming can sngar bshad pa gang yin pa de dag shar la sogs pa'i sgo bzhi la gnas pa 'phags pa gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa khro bo'i rgyal po bzhi'i mtshan
translated: Similarly, the four means of gathering, such as generosity, which are explained above as having the name of being meaningful, are the four wrathful kings such as the ƒÅrya Yamantaka who reside at the four gates of the east and so on.üîΩ

original: ma thob la sogs pa bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi sems nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ma thob la sogs pa bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi sems nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should know that the four means of gathering, such as generosity, which are explained above as having the nature of the four gates of liberation such as emptiness, are the nature of the four kings of wrath such as the ƒÅrya Yamarƒ´, who reside at the four gates such as the east.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that,

original: de bzhin shar sgor zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin shar sgor zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: it is taught by ‚ÄúLikewise, at the eastern gate‚Äù and so forth.

original: phyag rgya dgod pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyi rol gyi mtshan ma'i phyag rgya dgod pa'i de kho na nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyag rgya dgod pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyi rol gyi mtshan ma'i phyag rgya dgod pa'i de kho na nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The characteristic of setting out the seals is the reality of setting out the external symbolic seals.

original: legs par zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid nye bar sdud par bstan to //
analyzed: legs par zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid nye bar sdud par bstan to //
translated: It is taught by ‚ÄúWell explained‚Äù and so forth that the reality of the ma·πá·∏çala is summarized.

original: legs par bshad pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du gsal bar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: legs par bshad pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du gsal bar bshad pa'o //
translated: Well explained is clearly explained as it is.

original: ji lta ba'i dbyibs kyis mchod pa zhes pa ni de dang 'dra ba'i rang gi sems nyid do //
