analyzed: ji lta ba'i dbyibs kyis mchod pa zhes pa ni de dang 'dra ba'i rang gi sems nyid do //
translated: The worship of the way things are is one's own mind, which is similar to that.

original: rnam gsum bsgoms pas gyur pa yin //
analyzed: rnam gsum bsgoms pas gyur pa yin //
translated: It is the result of the cultivation of the three.

original: zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum gyi mchod pas mchod par byed de 'od gsal ba la 'jug go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum gyi mchod pas mchod par byed de 'od gsal ba la 'jug go //
translated: One worships with the worship of the three intuitions of appearance and so on, and enters the clearlight transparency.

original: de nyid rnam pa gsum gyi mchod pa yin te //
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa gsum gyi mchod pa yin te //
translated: That is the worship of the three aspects,

original: mchod pa'i 'bras bu yin pas so //
analyzed: mchod pa'i 'bras bu yin pas so //
translated: because it is the result of worship.

original: dang por chen po zhes pa ni mchod pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: dang por chen po zhes pa ni mchod pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: First, the great is a particular kind of worship.

original: des na sems rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mchod pa ni mchod pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na sems rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mchod pa ni mchod pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the worship whose characteristic is the purification of the mind is called the great worship.

original: de yi brtul zhugs mi bshad de //
analyzed: de yi brtul zhugs mi bshad de //
translated: One should not explain its observances,

original: bgrang phreng ma yin bzlas pa min //
analyzed: bgrang phreng ma yin bzlas pa min //
translated: not counting on a rosary, not reciting,

original: 'dzin pa dang ni sbyin sreg las //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang ni sbyin sreg las //
translated: not grasping, not performing burnt offerings,

original: gzhan dag kyang ni 'jug pa min //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang ni 'jug pa min // zhes 'byung ngo ;
translated: and not engaging in other practices.

original: / phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor yin par bshad //üîΩces bya ba las /
analyzed: / phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor yin par bshad //üîΩces bya ba las /
translated: It is explained as the mandala of the seal.

original: phyag rgya ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin te chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin te chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The seal is the nature of the gnosis of the ultimate realm, and is called the ‚Äúultimate reality.‚Äù

original: de nyid snying po'i don len pas na dkyil 'khor zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid snying po'i don len pas na dkyil 'khor zhes bshad do //
translated: Since it takes up the meaning of the essence, it is explained as the ‚Äúma·πá·∏çala.‚Äù

original: nang la sogs pa'i dbye ba yin //
analyzed: nang la sogs pa'i dbye ba yin //
translated: The inner and so on are the divisions.

original: zhes pa ni snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang @220a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang @220a * //
translated: The sixteen instants are appearance, increase of appearance,

original: snang ba nye bar thob pa dang zhi ba dang stong pa dang shin du stong pa dang chen po stong pa dang thams cad stong pa dang shes rab dang thabs dang ma rig pa dang 'od gsal ba dang / nyin mo dang mtshan mo dang dus mtshams dang de dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid de skad cig ma bcu drug go //
analyzed: snang ba nye bar thob pa dang zhi ba dang stong pa dang shin du stong pa dang chen po stong pa dang thams cad stong pa dang shes rab dang thabs dang ma rig pa dang 'od gsal ba dang / nyin mo dang mtshan mo dang dus mtshams dang de dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid de skad cig ma bcu drug go //
translated: near attainment of appearance, peace, emptiness, great emptiness, all emptiness, wisdom, method, ignorance, clear light, day, night, and the characteristics of the conjunctions.

original: stong pa nyid bcu drug ces zer ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcu drug ces zer ro //
translated: They are called the ‚Äúsixteen emptinesses.‚Äù

original: de'i grangs kyis lo bcu drug lon pa'i sems nyid de shes rab bstan to //
analyzed: de'i grangs kyis lo bcu drug lon pa'i sems nyid de shes rab bstan to //
translated: The sixteen years of the mind are explained to be wisdom.

original: ma skyes pa yi zhi ba gang //
analyzed: ma skyes pa yi zhi ba gang //
translated: What is the peace of the unborn?

original: zhes pa ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i de kho na nyid ni chos nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i de kho na nyid ni chos nyid do //
translated: This is the reality that has not arisen from the beginning.

original: spros pa thams cad dang bral bas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad dang bral bas na zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace, because it is free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: rkyen gzhan med pa zhi ba ni //
analyzed: rkyen gzhan med pa zhi ba ni //
translated: The peace that is not dependent on other conditions

original: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
analyzed: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
translated: is not elaborated by conceptual elaborations.

original: tha dad ma yin du ma min //
analyzed: tha dad ma yin du ma min //
translated: It is neither different nor multiple.

original: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is the characteristic of reality.

original: zhes so // bud med ces pa ni /
analyzed: zhes so // bud med ces pa ni /
translated: The ‚Äúwoman‚Äù is

original: shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa zhes bshad do //üîΩzhi ba'i chos dang rjes ldan pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa zhes bshad do // zhi ba'i chos dang rjes ldan pa //
translated: explained as the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe one who is endowed with the peace of phenomenaüîΩis the one who has the good radiance that is in accord with the peace of phenomena.

original: zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i sems tsam de nyid kyi zhi ba'i chos dang rjes su 'gro ba'i yon tan gang yin ba de ni mdangs bzang 'od yin par bshad do //üîΩrten 'brel bag chags dri yin te //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i sems tsam de nyid kyi zhi ba'i chos dang rjes su 'gro ba'i yon tan gang yin ba de ni mdangs bzang 'od yin par bshad do // rten 'brel bag chags dri yin te //
translated: This is the mere mind that enters into clear light.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: The stains of dependent origination are the habitual tendencies.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa de nyid rten cing 'brel pa bcom pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bag chags te dang rig pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni sems kyi rgyud dga' bar byed pas na dri zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa de nyid rten cing 'brel pa bcom pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bag chags te dang rig pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni sems kyi rgyud dga' bar byed pas na dri zhes bya'o //
translated: That perfection of wisdom itself is the instinct of the dependent origination of the Dharma of the knowledge of liberation, and it is called ‚Äúscent‚Äù because it delights the stream of mind.

original: nyon mongs pa las rnam grol ba'i //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las rnam grol ba'i //
translated: Liberation from the afflictions

original: snang ba gsum dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba gsum dang bral ba'o //
translated: is free from the three appearances.

original: zhes 'byung bas so //üîΩye shes kha phye me tog go //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas so // ye shes kha phye me tog go //
translated: Thus it is.

original: zhes pa ni /üîΩde ltar gyur pa'i 'od gsal ba'i ye shes las kha phye ba ni cig car ram snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas ye shes te sku bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed
analyzed: zhes pa ni / de ltar gyur pa'i 'od gsal ba'i ye shes las kha phye ba ni cig car ram snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas ye shes te sku bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba ma lus pa'i re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed
translated: The flower is the opening of intuition.

original: pas dga' ba bskyed pas na me tog ces bya'o //
analyzed: pas dga' ba bskyed pas na me tog ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, the intuition that is the opening of the intuition of clear light, either instantaneously or by the process of the attainment of the appearance of the limit of reality, etc., which generates the body, is called ‚Äúflower‚Äù because it generates delight by fulfilling the hopes of all migrating beings.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i dri dang me tog dag gis brgyan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bud med ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i dri dang me tog dag gis brgyan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bud med ces bya'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom adorned with such scents and flowers is called ‚Äúwoman.‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa rigs yin te //
analyzed: dngos po med pa rigs yin te //
translated: The absence of entities is the lineage.

original: zhes pa ni de nyid kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mi zad pa thog ma dang tha ma med pa chos kyi dbyings kyi de kho na nyid rang bzhin med pa'i rigs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de nyid kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mi zad pa thog ma dang tha ma med pa chos kyi dbyings kyi de kho na nyid rang bzhin med pa'i rigs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the timeless awareness of omniscience itself, inexhaustible, without beginning or end, the suchness of the basic space of phenomena, the so-called ‚Äúlineage of the absence of intrinsic nature.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad ni 'od gsal ba las byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar chu bo dang ba las //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni 'od gsal ba las byung ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar chu bo dang ba las //
translated: This is because all phenomena arise from utter lucidity.üîΩJust as fish swiftly leap

original: nya dag myur bar ldang ba ltar //üîΩthams cad stong pa dang ba las //
analyzed: nya dag myur bar ldang ba ltar // thams cad stong pa dang ba las //
translated: from clear water,üîΩthe net of magical illusion

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba 'byung bar @220b 'gyur //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba 'byung bar @220b 'gyur //
translated: arises from the clarity of everything‚Äôs emptiness.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //üîΩde bzhin du //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo // de bzhin du //
translated: And:

original: 'od gsal dag pa de nyid las //üîΩye shes gsum ni yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: 'od gsal dag pa de nyid las // ye shes gsum ni yang dag 'byung //
translated: From that suchness, the clarity of utter lucidity,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //üîΩchos dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo // chos dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni //
translated: the three aspects of timeless awareness truly arise.

original: sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo 'od gsal gyi rang bzhin bud med de /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo 'od gsal gyi rang bzhin bud med de /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe basic space of phenomena‚Äù and so forth refers to the female aspect, the nature of utter lucidity, which is the essence of the timeless awareness of the basic space of phenomena, having the characteristics explained above.

original: sa bcu gnyis pa la shes rab mnyam par bya ba ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas mnyes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa bcu gnyis pa la shes rab mnyam par bya ba ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas mnyes par bya'o //
translated: On the twelfth stage, the wisdom should be made equal by pleasing with the stages of mantra and seal.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab ni sngags kyi mtshan nyid dang phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab ni sngags kyi mtshan nyid dang phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: Therefore, with the wisdom endowed with the characteristics of mantra and the characteristics of seal.

original: sgyu ma thams cad rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: sgyu ma thams cad rnams kyis ni //
translated: With all the illusions,

original: bud med sgyu ma khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: bud med sgyu ma khyad par 'phags //
translated: the illusion of a woman is supreme.

original: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba ni //
analyzed: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba ni //
translated: The division of the three wisdoms

original: de las gsal bar mtshon par byed //üîΩces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las gsal bar mtshon par byed // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: is clearly indicated by that.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab m'a ma k'i'i ming gis tha snyad bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab m'a ma k'i'i ming gis tha snyad bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the stage of the pure mind is the nature of clear light, the wisdom is designated by the name of Mamaki.

original: nang na ma yin phyi na min //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: nang na ma yin phyi na min // zhes smos te /
translated: Not inside, not outside,

original: nang ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: nang ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams so //
translated: Inside refers to the sense bases such as the eyes.

original: phyi ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams so //
analyzed: phyi ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams so //
translated: Outside refers to the objects such as form.

original: gnyis ka ni sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten dag go //
analyzed: gnyis ka ni sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten dag go //
translated: Both refers to the world of sentient beings and the world of the vessel.

original: rnam par rtog pa de dag gsum spangs pas gnas med pa'i 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de dag gsum spangs pas gnas med pa'i 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The clear light without a basis is due to the abandonment of those three conceptualizations.

original: de la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ni 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa gang yin pa de ni m'a ma k'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ni 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa gang yin pa de ni m'a ma k'i zhes bya'o //
translated: The yoga abiding in that is the connection with the characteristic of engagement, which is called ‚ÄúmƒÅmakƒ´.‚Äù

original: m'a ma'i sgras ni dgag pa gnyis rjod par byed pa dang / k'i'i sgras kyang phur bus gdab pa bzhin du dgag pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: m'a ma'i sgras ni dgag pa gnyis rjod par byed pa dang / k'i'i sgras kyang phur bus gdab pa bzhin du dgag pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term mƒÅma expresses the two negations, and the term kƒ´ also indicates the negation, like a stake.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid gcig pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid gcig pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: The reality that is the single nature of that is the reality characterized by the connate joy, the nature of clear light.

original: gcig ni gnyis su med pa ste rnal 'byor la 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gcig ni gnyis su med pa ste rnal 'byor la 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The single is nondual, and the engagement in yoga is called ‚Äúthe consecration.‚Äù

original: nam mkha' dang ni gcig tu gnas //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ni gcig tu gnas //
translated: Abiding as one with space,

original: zhes pa de ni nam mkha'i dbyings dang 'dra ba mi gos pa de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa de ni nam mkha'i dbyings dang 'dra ba mi gos pa de kho na nyid do //
translated: that is the reality that is like the realm of space, unstained.

original: spros pa med pas ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: spros pa med pas ni zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace, because it is free from elaborations.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas na sangs rgyas kyi gnas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas na sangs rgyas kyi gnas so //
translated: Since it is the cause of the generation of all Buddhas, it is the abode of the Buddhas.

original: 'gyur ni bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ni bsgom par bya'o //
translated: It should be cultivated.

original: gang g'a'i bye ma dang mtshungs pa'i //üîΩ'di nyid las ni sangs rgyas 'gyur //
analyzed: gang g'a'i bye ma dang mtshungs pa'i // 'di nyid las ni sangs rgyas 'gyur //
translated: From it alone, equal to the sands of the Ganges,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the Buddhas arise.

original: de bas na 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, in order to enter into the reality of clear light,üîΩthe imagined object is taught to be form, etc.

original: yul du rnam brtags pa zhes pa ni mig la sogs pas longs spyod pa gzugs la @221a * //üîΩla sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: yul du rnam brtags pa zhes pa ni mig la sogs pas longs spyod pa gzugs la @221a * // la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: , which are enjoyed by the eye, etc.

original: sdud pa dag ni bshad pa yin //
analyzed: sdud pa dag ni bshad pa yin //
translated: The aggregates are explained to be the collectors.

original: zhes pa mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la 'jug pas na de kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la 'jug pas na de kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: The eye, etc., are called the sense-fields because they enter into the sense organs, the eye, etc.

original: ye shes dbang po stong pa gci //
analyzed: ye shes dbang po stong pa gci //
translated: The emptiness of the sense organs is the wisdom sense organ.

original: zhes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa drug dang / de bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug gang yin pa de rnams kyi stong pa ni 'od gsal ba'i chos nyid gci ba yin te nyon mongs pa thams cad zad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa drug dang / de bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug gang yin pa de rnams kyi stong pa ni 'od gsal ba'i chos nyid gci ba yin te nyon mongs pa thams cad zad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The six beginning with the eye consciousness, and likewise the six faculties beginning with the eye, their emptiness is the clear light, the reality, because it causes the exhaustion of all afflictions.

original: rnam pa dag chos ni zhes pa ni rang bzhin brgya drug cu'i tshogs spong bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa dag chos ni zhes pa ni rang bzhin brgya drug cu'i tshogs spong bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The Dharma is the collection of the one hundred and sixty natures, and its characteristic is the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: de nyid srid pa la 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi mya ngan gcod pas na khu ba zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de nyid srid pa la 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi mya ngan gcod pas na khu ba zhes bya'o ;
translated: Since it cuts off the sorrow whose characteristic is the wandering in existence, it is called semen.

original: / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni 'od gsal ba la rtogs pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni 'od gsal ba la rtogs pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The gnosis of omniscience is the clear light, and its characteristic is the gnosis of realization.

original: sems can gyi don gyi bya ba la rjes su chags pas de nyid khrag ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don gyi bya ba la rjes su chags pas de nyid khrag ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is attached to the performance of the welfare of sentient beings, it is called blood.

original: gang zhig chos rnams yongs su brtags pa //
analyzed: gang zhig chos rnams yongs su brtags pa //
translated: That which fully investigates phenomena

original: zhes pa ni phyi dang nang gi chos te bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pas brda ru byas pas dbang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyi dang nang gi chos te bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pas brda ru byas pas dbang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the outer and inner phenomena, the five nectars, etc., which are the symbols of the sense organs, etc.

original: de nyid lha rnams zhes pa ni chos nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid lha rnams zhes pa ni chos nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The gods are the realities, because they enter into reality.

original: dngos po med pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la sngar bshad pa'i de rnams dbul pa ni 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la sngar bshad pa'i de rnams dbul pa ni 'jug par bya'o //
translated: The non-entity is the emptiness which is the characteristic of the pure mind. In that, one should offer the previously explained those.

original: de ni bdud rtsi lnga 'bul ba //
analyzed: de ni bdud rtsi lnga 'bul ba //
translated: That is the offering of the five nectars.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained.

original: de byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir sangs rgyas dang rgyal sras ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir sangs rgyas dang rgyal sras ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The doing that etc. is here the aggregates, etc. of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: khyad par du zhes pa ni the tshom med pas so //
analyzed: khyad par du zhes pa ni the tshom med pas so //
translated: The distinction is the absence of doubt.

original: mnyes par gyur pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyes par gyur pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The being pleased is the becoming of clear light.

original: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyi'i dkyil 'khor la mngon par zhen pa'i lta ba gang yin pa de rnams kyis de spang par bya ba'i phyir de ltar sems kyi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid bstan te /
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyi'i dkyil 'khor la mngon par zhen pa'i lta ba gang yin pa de rnams kyis de spang par bya ba'i phyir de ltar sems kyi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid bstan te /
translated: The phrase and so on indicates that those views which are fixations on the external mandala are to be abandoned, and thus the characteristic of the nature of mind is taught.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyi gsungs so zhes tshig gi lhag ma bstan to //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das kyi gsungs so zhes tshig gi lhag ma bstan to //
translated: The phrase as taught in the explanatory tantra indicates the remainder of the passage.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach just that,üîΩit is said,

original: de ltar bri ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bstan pas zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ltar bri ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bstan pas zhes smos te /
translated: by the teaching of the mandala to be drawn and so on.

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor bri ba dang mchod pa la sogs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor bri ba dang mchod pa la sogs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: By the process of drawing the external mandala and making offerings and so on,üîΩthe nature of the completely pure deity is fully present.

original: yongs su dag pa'i lha'i ngo bo nyid rab tu gnas pa yin te zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dag gis thob par byed pa yid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku bstan to //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i lha'i ngo bo nyid rab tu gnas pa yin te zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dag gis thob par byed pa yid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku bstan to //
translated: This indicates the mental body, which is to be attained by means of the completely pure mind and the consecration of self-consecration.

original: nges pa'i don to zhes @221b pa la sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa gnyis bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to zhes @221b pa la sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa gnyis bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The definitive meaning is because of the teaching of the two, the mind of purification and the stage of self-consecration.

original: thugs rdo rje zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje bdag po nyid du 'jug pa 'dri ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje bdag po nyid du 'jug pa 'dri ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The mind-vajra is the one who enters into the state of the lord of the mind-vajra. The meaning of mandala is the circle of the assembly.

original: dkyil ni snying po ste zhes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rdul tshon la sogs pa nyid du snang ba'o //
analyzed: dkyil ni snying po ste zhes pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'i rdul tshon la sogs pa nyid du snang ba'o //
translated: The center is the essence, which is the appearance as the imagined colored powders, etc.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes pa ni gzhi'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes pa ni gzhi'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The relative truth is the meaning of basic mandala.

original: de len cing 'dzin pas na dkyil 'khor te zhes pa ni byin gyis rlob par byed pa gang yin pa de ni lha'i 'khor lo'i bdag nyid kyi rten pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin pas na dkyil 'khor te zhes pa ni byin gyis rlob par byed pa gang yin pa de ni lha'i 'khor lo'i bdag nyid kyi rten pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mandala is that which takes up and holds. The meaning of supported mandala is that which is consecrated, which is the nature of the circle of deities.

original: drang ba'i don to zhes pa ni rten dang brten pa'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: drang ba'i don to zhes pa ni rten dang brten pa'i rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor so sor bstan pas so //
translated: The provisional meaning is because of the teaching of the individual mandalas of the nature of the supported and the support.

original: dkyil 'khor ni snying po de don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa thob par bya ba'i de kho na nyid bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ni snying po de don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa thob par bya ba'i de kho na nyid bzhi pa'o //
translated: The mandala is the essence, the ultimate truth. This is the fourth reality, which is to be attained by the stage of the purification of the mind.

original: de len cing 'dzin pa na dkyil 'khor de zhes pa ni dngos po thams cad kyi de kho na nyid du gyur pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa len par byed pa ting nge 'dzin gyis thob par byed pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de len cing 'dzin pa na dkyil 'khor de zhes pa ni dngos po thams cad kyi de kho na nyid du gyur pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa len par byed pa ting nge 'dzin gyis thob par byed pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one takes up and holds that mandala, it is called the ‚Äúmandala of the ultimate truth, which is the reality of all things,‚Äù and the wisdom that is attained by means of the meditative concentration that takes it up is called the ‚Äúwisdom that takes up the ultimate truth.‚Äù

original: lung gi tshad ma nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lung gi tshad ma nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the validity of the scriptures,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúAs it is said,‚Äù and so on.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud ces bya ba ni rdo rje phreng ba las so //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud ces bya ba ni rdo rje phreng ba las so //
translated: The explanatory tantra is the Vajra-garland.

original: yan lag kun bsgom las 'das shing //
analyzed: yan lag kun bsgom las 'das shing //
translated: ‚Äú Transcending all the branches of meditation‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni dang por sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog dang las kyi rgyal ba mchog ste bsgom pa'i yan lag kun no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dang por sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog dang las kyi rgyal ba mchog ste bsgom pa'i yan lag kun no //
translated: refers to all the branches of meditation, beginning with the initial application, the mandala of the supreme victor, and the action of the supreme victor.

original: de las 'das pa ni de dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las 'das pa ni de dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Beyond that is said to be free from that.

original: rtog pa ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rlung gi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ni 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rlung gi spyod pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization is the activity of the wind that has the character of entering, abiding, and rising.

original: rtog min ni snang ba gsum dang rang bzhin rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rtog min ni snang ba gsum dang rang bzhin rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Nonconceptualization is the three appearances and the three natures.üîΩFree from that, abandoned, is the abandonment of those by the reality that purifies the appearance of the nature.

original: de dang bral ba rnam par spangs pa zhes pa ni rang bzhin snang ba rnam par dag par byed pa'i de kho na nyid kyis de rnams spangs pa'o / gug skyed ni ai la sogs pa dbyangs bcu drug go //
analyzed: de dang bral ba rnam par spangs pa zhes pa ni rang bzhin snang ba rnam par dag par byed pa'i de kho na nyid kyis de rnams spangs pa'o / gug skyed ni ai la sogs pa dbyangs bcu drug go //
translated: The anusvƒÅra is the sixteen vowels such as i and so on.

original: thig le ni snying ga la dgod pa'i yungs kar phra mo'i tshad tsam mo //
analyzed: thig le ni snying ga la dgod pa'i yungs kar phra mo'i tshad tsam mo //
translated: The bindu is the size of a mustard seed placed at the heart.

original: 'das pa ni de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa ni de dang bral ba'o //
translated: Beyond that is free from that.

original: 'di ni dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni snying por gyur pa'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid ces bya ste /üîΩthams cad stong pa 'od gsal ba //
analyzed: 'di ni dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni snying por gyur pa'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid ces bya ste / thams cad stong pa 'od gsal ba //
translated: This is the ma·πá·∏çala, which is called the reality of the luminous essence.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained as ‚Äúthe luminous emptiness of everything.‚Äù

original: mchog yin no zhes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: mchog yin no zhes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Supreme means the nature of ultimate truth.

original: nges pa'i don to @222a * //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to @222a * //
translated: The definitive meaning.

original: zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pas 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pas 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the reality of clear light is taught by the pure mind.

original: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i t'i k'a las le'u bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i t'i k'a las le'u bzhi pa'o /
translated: This concludes the fourth chapter of the Illuminating Lamp.

original: // / rim pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u lnga pa'i bshad pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: // / rim pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u lnga pa'i bshad pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: The two stages, etc.

original: de la le'u dang po nas rnam pa gnyis kyi lha'i sku bstan to //
analyzed: de la le'u dang po nas rnam pa gnyis kyi lha'i sku bstan to //
translated: The first chapter teaches the deity body in two aspects.

original: le'u gnyis pa nas don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig tu bstan to //
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa nas don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig tu bstan to //
translated: The second chapter teaches only the ultimate truth.

original: le'u gsum pa nas lha'i sku'i bdag nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: le'u gsum pa nas lha'i sku'i bdag nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan to //
translated: The third chapter teaches the conventional truth, which is the nature of the deity body.

original: le'u bzhi pa nas kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i bdag nyid kyi thugs kyi dkyil 'khor bstan to //
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa nas kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i bdag nyid kyi thugs kyi dkyil 'khor bstan to //
translated: The fourth chapter teaches the mind mandala, which is the nature of the conventional and ultimate truths.

original: de ltar bsgoms pas rim pa gnyis yongs su rtogs pa'i rim pa gnyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms pas rim pa gnyis yongs su rtogs pa'i rim pa gnyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: By meditating in that way, one realizes the two stages.

original: dbang bskur ba thob pas kyang zhes pa ni le'u bzhi pa nas gsungs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba thob pas kyang zhes pa ni le'u bzhi pa nas gsungs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: And even by one who has received empowerment refers to the procedure taught in chapter four.

original: spyod pa dang bral bas ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni spros pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gsum gyi spyod pa spangs nas rnal 'byor pas dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya'i don to //
analyzed: spyod pa dang bral bas ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni spros pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gsum gyi spyod pa spangs nas rnal 'byor pas dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya'i don to //
translated: It is not the case that one who is devoid of practice will not succeed, meaning that the yogin will not attain power by abandoning the three kinds of practice, such as the elaborate.

original: gang gi phyir rim gyis bsgom pa dang goms pas bla na med pa'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rim gyis bsgom pa dang goms pas bla na med pa'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because one will attain the unsurpassed state by gradual meditation and familiarization.

original: spyod pa ni rgyu yin te des 'bras bur gyur pa'i de kho na nyid khong du chung par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyod pa ni rgyu yin te des 'bras bur gyur pa'i de kho na nyid khong du chung par 'gyur ro //
translated: Practice is the cause, by which one will understand reality, which is the effect.

original: goms pas thob par bya ba yin gyi rang bzhin gyis thob par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: goms pas thob par bya ba yin gyi rang bzhin gyis thob par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is to be attained by familiarization, not to be attained by nature.

original: goms pa'i sbyor bas ci zhig bya //üîΩgzod nas grub pa'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: goms pa'i sbyor bas ci zhig bya // gzod nas grub pa'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: What is the use of the application of familiarization?üîΩThe nature that is primordially established

original: de nyid rang bzhin gyis grub kyi /
analyzed: de nyid rang bzhin gyis grub kyi /
translated: is just that, established by nature,

original: rnam rtog las skyes ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam rtog las skyes ma yin no //
translated: not arisen from conceptualization.

original: ye shes rim pa spangs nas ni //
analyzed: ye shes rim pa spangs nas ni //
translated: Having abandoned the stages of wisdom,

original: gang zhig 'di ltar rtog byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di ltar rtog byed pa //
translated: Whoever thus conceives

original: de yi dbye ba mi shes pas //
analyzed: de yi dbye ba mi shes pas //
translated: does not know their division,

original: phyir yang de rnams slob bzhin 'gyur //
analyzed: phyir yang de rnams slob bzhin 'gyur //
translated: and so they are again like learners.

original: las dang po yi 'jig rten 'di //
analyzed: las dang po yi 'jig rten 'di //
translated: In this world of beginners,

original: don dam pa las 'jug pa'i phyir //
analyzed: don dam pa las 'jug pa'i phyir //
translated: because of engaging in the ultimate,

original: thabs 'di rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: thabs 'di rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: this method was taught by the perfect Buddha

original: skas kyi rim pa lta bur gsungs //
analyzed: skas kyi rim pa lta bur gsungs //
translated: like the steps of a staircase.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes pa ni sku rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes pa ni sku rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: All tathƒÅgatas refers to Vajradhara and so forth.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid can gyi zhes pa nye bar sdud par byed pa dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi bdag nyid can gyi zhes pa nye bar sdud par byed pa dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The one who is the nature of body, speech, and mind is the glorious Vajrasattva, the one who is the compiler.üîΩIn that regard:

original: de la / rigs ni rnam pa brgyar bstan te /
analyzed: de la / rigs ni rnam pa brgyar bstan te /
translated: The family is taught to be of one hundred types,

original: mdor bsdus pa ni rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ni rnam pa lnga //
translated: but in brief, it is of five types.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division of body, speech, and mind,

original: phyi nas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
analyzed: phyi nas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur //
translated: it later becomes of three types.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams kyi bdag po yin pas na rgyal po ste khams gsum gyi bdag po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de rnams kyi bdag po yin pas na rgyal po ste khams gsum gyi bdag po'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the King, because he is the Lord of those, the Lord of the three realms.

original: sa 'og @222b dang sa steng dang mtho ris rnams su rjes su ston par mdzad pas na zhes pa ni mtho ris dang sa bla dang sa 'og la gnas pa'i sems can gyi khams gdul ba la brtson pas ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa 'og @222b dang sa steng dang mtho ris rnams su rjes su ston par mdzad pas na zhes pa ni mtho ris dang sa bla dang sa 'og la gnas pa'i sems can gyi khams gdul ba la brtson pas ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is the Teacher because he is diligent in subduing the realm of sentient beings who dwell in heaven, above the earth, and below the earth.

original: khyab 'jug dang lha chen po la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi lha rnams shes pa la mngon par shes pa lnga thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab 'jug dang lha chen po la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi lha rnams shes pa la mngon par shes pa lnga thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The worldly gods such as Vishnu and Mahesvara are called gods because they have attained the five superknowledges.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa zhes pa ni //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa zhes pa ni //
translated: The Sravakas, etc.

original: nyan thos pa dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: nyan thos pa dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: are the Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes pa ni mngon par shes pa drug thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes pa ni mngon par shes pa drug thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called supramundane because they have attained the six superknowledges.

original: yang na bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa'i phyogs kyi lta ba gtso bo yin pas 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa'i phyogs kyi lta ba gtso bo yin pas 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid do //
translated: Or else, it is mundane and supramundane because it is the view of the side with self and the side without self.

original: yang na rnam par 'tshe ba dang bcas pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba med pas so //
analyzed: yang na rnam par 'tshe ba dang bcas pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba med pas so //
translated: Or else, it is with violence and without violence.

original: rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas zil gyis gnon par mdzad pas na zhes pa ni 'bar ba dang snang ba la sogs pa lus kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / bstan pa la sogs pa gsung gi rdzu 'phrul dang / rtse gcig pa la sogs pa thugs kyi rdzu 'phrul gyis de rnams zil gyis gnon par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas zil gyis gnon par mdzad pas na zhes pa ni 'bar ba dang snang ba la sogs pa lus kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / bstan pa la sogs pa gsung gi rdzu 'phrul dang / rtse gcig pa la sogs pa thugs kyi rdzu 'phrul gyis de rnams zil gyis gnon par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the subjugation of miracles, etc. because it subjugates them by the miracle of body, such as blazing and radiating, by the miracle of speech, such as teaching, and by the miracle of mind, such as one-pointedness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rgya mtsho yi ni gting mi rnyed //
analyzed: rgya mtsho yi ni gting mi rnyed //
translated: The depth of the ocean is not found.

original: ba yi rjes dang 'dra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ba yi rjes dang 'dra bar 'gyur //
translated: It would be like the footprint of a cow.

original: gang tshe khyod kyi blo zab pa //
analyzed: gang tshe khyod kyi blo zab pa //
translated: When your mind is deep,

original: gting dang pha rol med mthong na /
analyzed: gting dang pha rol med mthong na /
translated: seeing no depth or far side,

original: khyod kyi bstan pa mngon gyur pas //
analyzed: khyod kyi bstan pa mngon gyur pas //
translated: your teaching is manifest,

original: chos rnams kun gyis mi g-yo ba //
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyis mi g-yo ba //
translated: unmoved by any phenomena.

original: sa yi khams kyi brtan pa nyid //
analyzed: sa yi khams kyi brtan pa nyid //
translated: The stability of the earth element

original: shing gi 'dab rtse ltar yang 'gyur //
analyzed: shing gi 'dab rtse ltar yang 'gyur //
translated: will become as light as a leaf-tip.

original: zhes 'byung ngo / bdag dang gzhan gyi tshogs kyi zhes pa ni de la bdag gi tshogs ni sngar bshad pa nyan thos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo / bdag dang gzhan gyi tshogs kyi zhes pa ni de la bdag gi tshogs ni sngar bshad pa nyan thos la sogs pa'o //
translated: The assemblies of self and others are as follows: The assembly of self is the previously explained ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: gzhan gyi tshogs ni grangs can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshogs ni grangs can la sogs pa'o //
translated: The assembly of others is the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, etc.

original: de rnams kyi spyod pa ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i spyod pa dang / skyes bu la sogs pa yod pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi spyod pa ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i spyod pa dang / skyes bu la sogs pa yod pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Their conduct is the conduct of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, and the characteristics, etc. of the existence of persons, etc.

original: mchog gi chos shes pa ni yon tan mchog dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mchog gi chos shes pa ni yon tan mchog dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of supreme Dharma is endowed with supreme qualities.

original: de rnams kyis don du gnyer bar bya ba'i phyir don to //
analyzed: de rnams kyis don du gnyer bar bya ba'i phyir don to //
translated: For the sake of their striving for that, it is the aim.

original: de nas las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de nas las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Then, grasping the activity is as follows.

original: de ltar rang dang gzhan gyi tshogs kyis mngon par 'dod par bya ba bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar rang dang gzhan gyi tshogs kyis mngon par 'dod par bya ba bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the aim is the BhagavƒÅn MahƒÅvajradhara, who is to be desired by the assemblies of self and others.

original: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'od zer gyi 'khor los bskul bas mu stegs pa dang nyan thos la sogs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur te /üîΩbsod @223a * //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'od zer gyi 'khor los bskul bas mu stegs pa dang nyan thos la sogs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur te / bsod @223a * //
translated: Since they are urged by the circle of light rays of the Buddhas, the tƒ´rthikas, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and so on attain complete perfect enlightenment.

original: nams kyi ni tshogs bsags nas //
analyzed: nams kyi ni tshogs bsags nas //
translated: Having accumulated the collection of merit,

original: de yang 'jig rten 'dren par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩthar pa 'dod pa thams cad kyis kyang /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten 'dren par 'gyur // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro // thar pa 'dod pa thams cad kyis kyang /
translated: they too become guides of the world.üîΩSince all who desire liberation must supplicate omniscience,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsol ba gdab par bya ba yin pas so zhes pa ni mu stegs dang nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dod pas so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsol ba gdab par bya ba yin pas so zhes pa ni mu stegs dang nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'dod pas so //
translated: all the tƒ´rthikas, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and so on desire omniscience.

original: sems ni rab tu 'jug pa la //
analyzed: sems ni rab tu 'jug pa la //
translated: The mind is fully engaged

original: spyod pa la ni 'jug mi bya //
analyzed: spyod pa la ni 'jug mi bya //
translated: but not engaged in conduct.

original: 'khor ba rab tu bcom pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'khor ba rab tu bcom pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to destroy sa·πÉsƒÅra,

original: kun gyi blo ni mnyam po yin //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: kun gyi blo ni mnyam po yin //üîΩzhes bshad do //
translated: the mind is equal to all.

original: spros pa dang bcas pa dang spros pa med pa dang shin du spros pa med pa ste spyod pa rnam pa gsum po zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis la brten te /
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa dang spros pa med pa dang shin du spros pa med pa ste spyod pa rnam pa gsum po zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis la brten te /
translated: The three kinds of conduct are elaborate, unelaborate and very unelaborate.üîΩ

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis spyod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis spyod par bya'o //
translated: With elaboration, without elaboration, and with utter nonelaboration‚Äîthese three kinds of conduct are to be practiced by the yogins and yoginƒ´s in dependence on the two stages.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas gnyis spyod pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas gcig spyod par bya ste khyad par ro //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas gnyis spyod pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas gcig spyod par bya ste khyad par ro //
translated: The yogin of the creation stage practices the two kinds of conduct, and the yogin of the completion stage practices the one kind of conduct. This is the distinction.

original: spyod pas ni khyad par ro zhes pa ni brtul zhugs kyi khyad par gang gis so //
analyzed: spyod pas ni khyad par ro zhes pa ni brtul zhugs kyi khyad par gang gis so //
translated: By the distinction of conduct, by the distinction of observances.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bo nyid de zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i spyod pa gsum gyi de kho na nyid do //üîΩbka' stsal pa ste zhes pa ni rig byed kyi tshul du dus log par bstan to //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bo nyid de zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i spyod pa gsum gyi de kho na nyid do // bka' stsal pa ste zhes pa ni rig byed kyi tshul du dus log par bstan to //
translated: Its definition is its own nature, that is, the reality of the three kinds of conduct that will be explained.üîΩThe statement is in the manner of the Vedas, taught in reverse order.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni spyod pa ji lta ji ltar gsungs zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni spyod pa ji lta ji ltar gsungs zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The literal meaning is as it is taught, in order to show the conduct as it is taught.

original: gang la brten nas spyod pa rdo rje theg pa de nyid kyi khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gang la brten nas spyod pa rdo rje theg pa de nyid kyi khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the special feature of that very Vajra Vehicle of Action on which one relies,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ste thab pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes pa la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ste thab pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes pa la /
translated: it is said, ‚Äúthe ultimate truth, which is the characteristic of the stage of light.‚ÄùüîΩThe essence of the perfection of wisdom, the characteristic of the reality of all phenomena, is the second and fourth stages of light.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo chos thams cad kyi chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'od gsal ba'i rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi pa thob par bya ba man ngag bzhi pa de kho na nyid ces bya'o ;
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo chos thams cad kyi chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'od gsal ba'i rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi pa thob par bya ba man ngag bzhi pa de kho na nyid ces bya'o ;
translated: The means of achieving the fourth instruction is called ‚Äúreality.‚Äù

original: / kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste zhes pa ni don thams cad byed pa la gzhol ba /
analyzed: / kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste zhes pa ni don thams cad byed pa la gzhol ba /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúthe conventional truth,‚Äù which is devoted to the performance of all aims.

original: rim pa gsum pa dang bzhi pa thob par bya ba ye shes kyi sku 'am rdo rje'i sku'i mtshan nyid de lha rnam pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rim pa gsum pa dang bzhi pa thob par bya ba ye shes kyi sku 'am rdo rje'i sku'i mtshan nyid de lha rnam pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The means of achieving the third and fourth stages is the characteristic of the gnosis body or vajra body, which is the characteristic of the yoga of the two kinds of deities.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgya che ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba 'gro ba'i don byed pa la brtson pa //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgya che ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba 'gro ba'i don byed pa la brtson pa //
translated: For that very reason, it is said, ‚Äúthe characteristic of the vast,‚Äù which is devoted to the performance of the aim of the world.

original: sar zhing sar pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo spros pas nam mkha'i khams ma lus pa rdzogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sar zhing sar pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo spros pas nam mkha'i khams ma lus pa rdzogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the mandala circle of the earth and the earth-lord is to fill the entire realm of space.

original: gnyis po de dag ces pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis so //
analyzed: gnyis po de dag ces pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis so //
translated: The two are the two truths, the conventional and the ultimate.

original: gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya @223b ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya @223b ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The nondual aspect is the aspect of the realm of nonabiding nirvana.

original: yang dag par ni ji ltar bstan pa de bzhin du bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par ni ji ltar bstan pa de bzhin du bsgom pa'o //
translated: Correctly is as taught.

original: rnal 'byor pa de zhes pa ni de lta bu'i sgrub pa po rnams so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de zhes pa ni de lta bu'i sgrub pa po rnams so //
translated: The yogis are the practitioners of such a practice.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pas 'khrugs kyang zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyi spyod pa spros pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba dang ldan pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pas 'khrugs kyang zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyi spyod pa spros pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba dang ldan pa yang ngo //
translated: Even though disturbed by desire and so forth means even though endowed with the conduct of desire, which is called elaborate.

original: theg pa mchog ni rdo rje theg pa zhes pa la sngags kyi theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa mchog ni rdo rje theg pa zhes pa la sngags kyi theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The supreme vehicle is the Vajra Vehicle, which is called the Great Vehicle of Mantra.

original: gtan tshigs bshad par bya ba'i phyir theg pa thams cad kyi bla mar gyur pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bshad par bya ba'i phyir theg pa thams cad kyi bla mar gyur pa zhes smos so //
translated: In order to explain the reason, it is said that it is the highest of all vehicles.

original: de la nyan thos pa'i theg pa ni theg pa chung ngu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la nyan thos pa'i theg pa ni theg pa chung ngu zhes bya ste /
translated: Among them, the vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas is called the lesser vehicle.

original: rang gi don tsam 'grub pa dang thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i lam dang 'bras bu ma dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi don tsam 'grub pa dang thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i lam dang 'bras bu ma dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impure in terms of the path and the result, which are the means and the end, and because it accomplishes only one's own purpose.

original: de la re zhig mi sdug pa'i bsgom pa ni keng rus bsgom pa'i bdag nyid yang dag pa'i lam ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig mi sdug pa'i bsgom pa ni keng rus bsgom pa'i bdag nyid yang dag pa'i lam ma yin te /
translated: Among them, the cultivation of repulsiveness is not the correct path, because it is the cultivation of a skeleton.

original: de dag ngo bo nyid kyis ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ngo bo nyid kyis ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those are not established by their own nature.

original: 'bras bu yang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni yang dag pa ma yin te bag chags dang bcas pa'i phyir dang slar yang de rnams byung nas 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor lhung ba'i phyir rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa yang gzhan gyis don dang bral bas
analyzed: 'bras bu yang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni yang dag pa ma yin te bag chags dang bcas pa'i phyir dang slar yang de rnams byung nas 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor lhung ba'i phyir rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa yang gzhan gyis don dang bral bas
translated: The result is also not correct, because it is characterized by the meditative attainment of cessation, because it is accompanied by traces, and because those again arise and one falls into the ocean of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: chung ba nyid de /
analyzed: chung ba nyid de /
translated: The vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas is also small,üîΩbecause it is devoid of the purpose of others.

original: de rnams kyi thar pas kyang 'dud par gyur pa rnam par rig pa tsam yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur pas ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi thar pas kyang 'dud par gyur pa rnam par rig pa tsam yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur pas ma dag pa'o //
translated: Since even those who bow down to them do not attain non-conceptuality through the characteristic of the mere existence of cognition, it is impure.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam yang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub thob pa'i phyir thabs nyid kho na ma yin no //üîΩrdo rje theg pa ni thabs dang 'bras bu dag la ma 'khrul ba yin te gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar spyod pa dang phyag rgya bsten pa la sogs pa'i bde ba'i thabs kyis 'ba' zhig dri ma med pa mtha' yas pa nam mkha'
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam yang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub thob pa'i phyir thabs nyid kho na ma yin no // rdo rje theg pa ni thabs dang 'bras bu dag la ma 'khrul ba yin te gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar spyod pa dang phyag rgya bsten pa la sogs pa'i bde ba'i thabs kyis 'ba' zhig dri ma med pa mtha' yas pa nam mkha'
translated: The bodhisattva path is not just a method for attaining enlightenment in three incalculable aeons.

original: dang 'dra ba chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes su grags pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang rang dang gzhan kyi don grub pa la brtson pa /
analyzed: dang 'dra ba chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes su grags pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang rang dang gzhan kyi don grub pa la brtson pa /
translated: The Vajra Vehicle is unmistaken regarding methods and results, because by the method of enjoying the five sense objects, relying on consorts, and so forth, one strives to accomplish one's own and others' goals in the state of Great Vajradhara, known as the wisdom of the dharmadhatu, which is stainless and infinite like space.

original: skad cig ma gcig gis sna tshogs sprul pa dang bsdu bar mdzad pa 'gro ba ma lus pa'i rang bzhin mngon du byed pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo de kho na nyid skad cig ma gcig gis thob par 'gyur te rgyu dang 'bras bu
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gis sna tshogs sprul pa dang bsdu bar mdzad pa 'gro ba ma lus pa'i rang bzhin mngon du byed pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo de kho na nyid skad cig ma gcig gis thob par 'gyur te rgyu dang 'bras bu
translated: In a single moment, one manifests the nature of all migrating beings, who emanate and gather in various ways, and one attains the essence of all tathagatas, thatness in a single moment, because the cause and result

original: la ma 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la ma 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: are not confused.

original: the tshom gyi bdag nyid kyi 'khrul pas de mngon du byed pa dang yun yang @224a * //
analyzed: the tshom gyi bdag nyid kyi 'khrul pas de mngon du byed pa dang yun yang @224a * //
translated: If one has doubts, one is confused, and it takes a long time to manifest thatness.

original: ring bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de yod na dag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ring bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de yod na dag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that exists, one will not be purified.

original: sbyong ba ni gang dang gang 'khrul ba'i ngo bo snang ba gtan tshigs la sogs pa de dag ma 'khrul ba'i 'bras bu la 'brel ba med de /
analyzed: sbyong ba ni gang dang gang 'khrul ba'i ngo bo snang ba gtan tshigs la sogs pa de dag ma 'khrul ba'i 'bras bu la 'brel ba med de /
translated: Purification is that whatever has the nature of confusion and appears is not related to the result of nonconfusion, such as a reason.

original: brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa las byung ba'i du ba la sogs pas me la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: brgya byin gyi spyi bo la sogs pa las byung ba'i du ba la sogs pas me la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like smoke and so on arising from the head of Indra and so on not being related to fire and so on.

original: nyan thos kyi lam la sogs pa 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin du snang bas mi 'khrul pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang 'bras bur gyur pa'i sgyu ma yin no zhes rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam la sogs pa 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin du snang bas mi 'khrul pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang 'bras bur gyur pa'i sgyu ma yin no zhes rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The path of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on are illusory because they appear to have the nature of error. They are the result, the stage of the nonerroneous Great Vajradhara.

original: ma 'khrul ba'i ngo bo snang ba'i lam gyis thob par bya ba dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang zhes nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'khrul ba'i ngo bo snang ba'i lam gyis thob par bya ba dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang zhes nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: The stage of glorious Vajradhara is to be attained by the path of the appearance of the nature of nonerror.

original: de bas na theg pa thams cad kyi mchog rdo rje theg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na theg pa thams cad kyi mchog rdo rje theg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Vajra Vehicle is said to be the best of all vehicles.

original: gcig la gcig ces zhes pa ni phan tshun la ltos pas so //
analyzed: gcig la gcig ces zhes pa ni phan tshun la ltos pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúOne in relation to the other‚Äù means in mutual dependence.

original: tshig lhag ma zhes pa ni tshig rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshig lhag ma zhes pa ni tshig rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe remainder of the words‚Äù means the completion of the words.

original: phul du phyung ba'i dngos grub ste zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku'o //
analyzed: phul du phyung ba'i dngos grub ste zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe supreme attainment‚Äù is the attainment of the great seal, the body of Great Vajradhara.

original: skyed par byed pa ni mngon du byed pa ste spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pas rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ni mngon du byed pa ste spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pas rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o zhes pa ni gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa'o zhes pa ni gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
translated: The non-intentional is the teaching of the reality of the clear light.

original: rang bzhin yongs su zhes bya ba la sogs pas rigs la sogs pa bkag par bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su zhes bya ba la sogs pas rigs la sogs pa bkag par bstan to //
translated: By the complete transformation of the nature, and so forth, the prohibition of the family, and so forth, is taught.

original: rdo rje theg pa la brten nas bla ma'i mang nang bsgom pa gang yin pa de rnams rigs la sogs pa dman pas kyang byang chub thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdo rje theg pa la brten nas bla ma'i mang nang bsgom pa gang yin pa de rnams rigs la sogs pa dman pas kyang byang chub thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Those who, relying on the Vajra Vehicle, meditate on the guru's instructions, even if they are of an inferior family, and so forth, will attain enlightenment.

original: skye ba sna tshogs rigs dang ni //
analyzed: skye ba sna tshogs rigs dang ni //
translated: Not dependent on various births, family,

original: yul dang dus la ma ltos pa //
analyzed: yul dang dus la ma ltos pa //
translated: place, or time,

original: bcom ldan khyod kyis bstan bcos ni //
analyzed: bcom ldan khyod kyis bstan bcos ni //
translated: the treatises of the BhagavƒÅn

original: thams cad la ni bstan pa lags //
analyzed: thams cad la ni bstan pa lags //
translated: are taught for all.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: skye gnas kyis smad pa nyid du bstan pa'o zhes pas ni rigs dman pa bstan to //
analyzed: skye gnas kyis smad pa nyid du bstan pa'o zhes pas ni rigs dman pa bstan to //
translated: By the teaching of the inferiority of the birth, the inferior family is taught.

original: las kyis so zhes pa ni ba lang gi pags pa dang gzhu la sogs pa byed pa dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa gdon pas so //
analyzed: las kyis so zhes pa ni ba lang gi pags pa dang gzhu la sogs pa byed pa dang mi gtsang ba la sogs pa gdon pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy action‚Äù means by making cow-hides, bows, etc., and by removing impurities, etc.

analyzed: sgyu ni yi ge pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi zhing la sogs pa 'phrog pas log par 'tsho ba'o // 'khrul 'khor dang zhes pa ni //
translated: ‚ÄúDeception‚Äù means a scribe‚Äôs wrong livelihood by stealing others‚Äô fields, etc.

original: btson ra'i khang pa la lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa 'ching ba'i shing la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: btson ra'i khang pa la lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa 'ching ba'i shing la sogs pa'o //

original: mtshon ni ral gri la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon ni ral gri la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWeapons‚Äù means swords, etc.

original: rgya ni ri dags la sogs pa bshor ba'i don du srad bu'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rgya ni ri dags la sogs pa bshor ba'i don du srad bu'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNets‚Äù means the use of strings for the purpose of hunting deer, etc.

original: @224b sogs pa'i sgras ni rtsig pa phug nas nor rku ba dang chang gi nang du dha du ra'i khu ba btab nas brgyal bar byed pa dang / lcags kyus nya bzung ba dang / grong la sogs pa la me gtong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @224b sogs pa'i sgras ni rtsig pa phug nas nor rku ba dang chang gi nang du dha du ra'i khu ba btab nas brgyal bar byed pa dang / lcags kyus nya bzung ba dang / grong la sogs pa la me gtong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refer to stealing wealth by digging a tunnel into a wall, causing intoxication by putting the juice of dhƒÅtrƒ´ fruit into beer, catching fish with a fish-hook, and setting fire to a village, etc.

translated: First, having served the master, means that having served the master through the stages of prior service and the divisions of time such as months, one obtains the initiation of reasoning and so on from the master who is pleased.üîΩHaving actualized the intimate instruction through the stages of listening and so on, one should say, ‚ÄúThis is the difference between my mind and the master‚Äôs mind,‚Äù because one possesses the wisdom of the connate state.üîΩ

Then, thinking, This is the special knowledge of mine, endowed with the wisdom of the innate, one should think, The master has not helped me at all. original: zhes pa ni /

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po khyad par du gyur pa bstan nas zhes pa ni spyod pa gsum gyi gzhir gyur pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po bstod nas so //

analyzed: bla ma'i zhal gyi man ngag med pas yang dag par gyur pa'i de kho na nyid kyi man ngag rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: spyod pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni spros pa med pa'i spyod pa'i khyad par ro //

analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud ni dgongs pa lung bstan pa'i bshad pa'i rgyud las so //

analyzed: phung po la sogs pa zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas dngos med pa ni 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang thams cad stong pa'i gnas @226b la 'jug pa'o //

original: zhi gnas las byung zhes pa ni //
analyzed: zhi gnas las byung zhes pa ni //

analyzed: zhi gnas kyi bsgom pas byas pa gang yin pa de rnams ni srog gcod par byed pa ste srog ni rlung yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i phung po lnga la sogs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: des sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa bstan to //

original: nang zhes bya ba la sogs pas nang dang phyi dang gnyis ka'i rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad stong pa yin no zhes lhag par mos pas ye shes kyi sku gzung ba sngon du 'gro bar bstan pa gang yin pa de la dga' ba ni brdzun smra ba

translated: The one who delights in the statement that all phenomena are empty of the nature of inner, outer, and both, which teaches that the wisdom body is apprehended by prior devotion, is one who delights in lying.

original: la dga' ba zhes bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: la dga' ba zhes bshad par bya ste /

analyzed: lha'i bu chos thams cad brdzun dang sgyu ma yin pa de skad bdag smra bas na /
translated: Because it is said, Divine son, I say that all phenomena are false and illusory,

original: des na de ni brdzun smra ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na de ni brdzun smra ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

original: gnas med la gnas rnal 'byor pa'o //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: gnas med la gnas rnal 'byor pa'o // zhes pa ni /

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe bcu gnyis la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe bcu gnyis la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: des ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the stage of self-consecration.

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gang //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gang //
translated: The wisdom of the perfect Buddha

original: zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin de kho na nyid rim pa lnga pas thob par bya ba'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin de kho na nyid rim pa lnga pas thob par bya ba'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the term ‚Äúgreat vajradhara stage,‚Äù which is to be attained by the five stages, the reality which is the nature of non-dwelling nirvana.

original: de nyid bstan pas na rdzas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pas na rdzas zhes bya ba ste /

original: brtan pa snying po khong stong med //
analyzed: brtan pa snying po khong stong med //

original: ces pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because of the statement, ‚ÄúIt is firm, substantial, and not hollow.‚Äù

original: de 'phrog dang tshul gang yin pa //
analyzed: de 'phrog dang tshul gang yin pa //
translated: The method of taking that

original: des ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa gsal bar bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: de nyid ces pa ni sngags dang rlung gi de kho na nyid rtogs pa sngon du 'gro bar ma ning gi bzlas pa'i dus su byung ba'i 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat reality‚Äù is the clear light which occurs at the time of the neuter repetition, preceded by the realization of the reality of mantra and wind.

original: de la dngos cig ni bsgom pa gang la yod pa de ni de nyid dngos cig ste rdo rje bzlas pa'i rnal 'byor ba zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de la dngos cig ni bsgom pa gang la yod pa de ni de nyid dngos cig ste rdo rje bzlas pa'i rnal 'byor ba zhes bstan to //
translated: Of these, the one reality is that which exists in any meditation, and that is the one reality, which is taught as the yogin of vajra repetition.

original: de bzhin nyid ni phyag rgya dang // ting nge 'dzin kyi rim pas thob pa'i 'od gsal ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni phyag rgya dang // ting nge 'dzin kyi rim pas thob pa'i 'od gsal ba'i gnas so //

analyzed: de la rtag tu sbyor ba ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: The sentient being who delights in that is the yogin of desire for reality, which is taught by the first and fourth stages, and the meaning is that he is the yogin of desire for reality.üîΩHe becomes the supreme

original: dam par 'gyur //
analyzed: dam par 'gyur //
translated: in the supreme practice.

original: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa lnga po de dag sngags kyi theg pa chen po la snod du gyur pa rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: de'i stong pa nyid gti mug la zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi gti mug ste mi shes pa ste ma rig pa'o //
translated: Its emptiness is delusion, that is, the delusion of emptiness, ignorance, non-knowledge.üîΩFrom that cause, fear is whatever is frightening.

original: rgyu de las skrag pa ni 'jigs pa gang yin pa de dag gcin gyi sgras ni dbang po rnams bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu de las skrag pa ni 'jigs pa gang yin pa de dag gcin gyi sgras ni dbang po rnams bshad do //

analyzed: yul rnams la 'jug pa'i rang bzhin yin pas bshad pa'i sgras ni yul rnams bstan to //

original: de dag zhi ba zab pa yin //
analyzed: de dag zhi ba zab pa yin //

analyzed: zhes pa ni dbang po dang yul dag yan lag drug pa'i phyogs gcig pa so sor sdud pa'i rim pas sbyor bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the sense-faculties and sense-objects are the one part of the six-limbed [body], and one should practice them by means of the sequence of withdrawal.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos mchog 'dir //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos mchog 'dir //
translated: In this supreme vehicle of the MahƒÅyƒÅna,

analyzed: zhes pa ni sgrub par byed pa dpal gsang ba 'dus pa zhes pa theg pa thams cad kyi mchog la //
translated: this means that one should practice in the glorious GuhyasamƒÅja, which is the supreme of all vehicles.

original: snod du gyur pa ni skal pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snod du gyur pa ni skal pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes a suitable vessel, that is, one becomes fortunate.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa zhes pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i sgra'i 'gal ba'i sgo nas rim pa lnga'i mtshan nyid dang / so sor sdud pa zhes bya bas de'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa zhes pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i sgra'i 'gal ba'i sgo nas rim pa lnga'i mtshan nyid dang / so sor sdud pa zhes bya bas de'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The so-called ‚Äúintentional explanation‚Äù is by way of the contradiction of the words ‚Äúkilling‚Äù and so forth, the characteristics of the five stages, and by way of the individual withdrawal, the teaching of their nature.

original: de ni rim pa lnga sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pas /
analyzed: de ni rim pa lnga sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la ye shes kyi phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pas /

original: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bstan to //
analyzed: shin tu spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bstan to //
translated: The extremely unelaborate conduct is taught.

original: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the elaborate conduct,

original: ma dang 'dra bar rjes su mthun pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ma dang 'dra bar rjes su mthun pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it says ‚Äúin accordance with the mother,‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: rigs dang rjes su mthun pas rnal 'byor pa la chags pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: It teaches the yoga to be in accordance with the family.

original: 'di rnams las gang yang rung ba zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams las gang yang rung ba zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rigs dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAny one of these‚Äù is in accordance with the family of Ak·π£hobhya and so on.

original: rang gi rigs kyi bud med ces pa la /
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi bud med ces pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own family woman‚Äù is

original: sme sha can dang / gar mkhan dang khrus mkhan dang bram ze mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sme sha can dang / gar mkhan dang khrus mkhan dang bram ze mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: the outcaste, the dancer, the washerman, the brahmin woman, and so on.

original: sgrub pa'i thabs las bshad pa'i rim pas zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig phyag rgya legs par sbyang bas so //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i thabs las bshad pa'i rim pas zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig phyag rgya legs par sbyang bas so //
translated: By the process explained in the Means of Achievement means by the process explained in the Means of Achievement of the Mandala of the Supreme Victor, by the thorough training in the one part of the samadhi, the seal.

original: rigs lnga bkod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid gsal bar bstan to //
analyzed: rigs lnga bkod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid gsal bar bstan to //
translated: The array of the five clans and so on clarifies that.

original: mnyes par byas pa ni rigs dang rjes su mthun pa shing gi sdong po la phyag la sogs pa byas nas mtshal la sogs pas bris pa ji ltar 'dod pa'i bza' ba dang bcas pa rang gi @227b brtul zhugs dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyag rgya dang bcas
analyzed: mnyes par byas pa ni rigs dang rjes su mthun pa shing gi sdong po la phyag la sogs pa byas nas mtshal la sogs pas bris pa ji ltar 'dod pa'i bza' ba dang bcas pa rang gi @227b brtul zhugs dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyag rgya dang bcas
translated: Having pleased means that, having made obeisance to the tree trunk in accordance with one's clan, and having written with vermilion and so on, one should enter into union with the seal who is in accordance with one's vow, and who is endowed with the desired food.

original: pa'i rnal 'byor pas snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i rnal 'byor pas snyoms par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: The yogi/ni should enter into union with the seal who is in accordance with one's vow, and who is endowed with the desired food.

original: de dngos grub rgya chen po zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang gi mtshan nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dngos grub rgya chen po zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang gi mtshan nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The great power is the attainment of the state characterized by Great Vajradhara.

original: mchog gi chos zhes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid gang la yod pa de dag / theg chen mchog gi chos nyid ces pa ni //
analyzed: mchog gi chos zhes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid gang la yod pa de dag / theg chen mchog gi chos nyid ces pa ni //
translated: Those which have the characteristic of non-conceptuality are the supreme dharmas.

analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi de kho na nyid so sor rig pas shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúyoga of the perfection of wisdom‚Äù is that one is a practitioner of the perfection of wisdom by individually cognizing the thatness of the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: de yi nang du dngos grub rgya che zhing //
analyzed: de yi nang du dngos grub rgya che zhing //
translated: The great siddhi is within that.

original: zhes pa la rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dngos grub ste rang dang gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa la rdo rje 'chang chen po'i dngos grub ste rang dang gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúgreat siddhi of Vajradhara‚Äù is that it is the characteristic of accomplishing one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô aims.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang rgya che ba ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang rgya che ba ma yin te /
translated: For the practitioner of the perfections, even perfect enlightenment is not great,

original: dus mang pos thob pa'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus mang pos thob pa'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is attained after a long time, and because the perfection of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô aims is small.

original: rdo rje theg pa las de las ldog pa thams cad yin no zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: rdo rje theg pa las de las ldog pa thams cad yin no zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: In the Vajra Vehicle, the opposite of all of that is the case, as has been explained above.

original: ldog pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir rjes su mi mthun pa'i phyag rgya dang mnyam par sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i shes rab dang 'brel bas so //
analyzed: ldog pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir rjes su mi mthun pa'i phyag rgya dang mnyam par sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i shes rab dang 'brel bas so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the opposite, it says, ‚Äúunion with an incompatible consort.‚Äù

original: rjes su mthun pa ni rigs dang mthun pa nyid gal te rtag par byed na de'i tshe dngos grub rten par 'gyur te /
